rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>1</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-8679509855889261178</id><published>2013-11-15T14:20:00.001-08:00</published><updated>2013-11-15T15:02:09.813-08:00</updated><title type='text'>Sorry, I have to...</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10876199453/" title="IMG_2172 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_2172" height="500" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5488/10876199453_628ce01384.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;I realize I have posted the same thing across all of my social networking things and places but I am so incredibly proud of my brother and keep refreshing all of the pages to read the commentary from the puzzling community &lt;a href="http://rexwordpuzzle.blogspot.com/2013/11/alpine-skier-julia-who-won-olympic-gold.html" target="_blank"&gt;who seem to be the kindest bunch in the land&lt;/a&gt; for welcoming David with&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="http://wordplay.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/11/14/performing-without-a-net/" target="_blank"&gt;high-fives&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;and hoorahs.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;David has spent the last few years constructing crossword puzzles as a side project and this, I assume, will be his first of many published puzzles. Because he's amazing. (He went as a crossword puzzle for Halloween one year. He literally made a crossword puzzle and wore it so that people could solve him during the party. AMAZING, RIGHT?)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;blockquote class="tr_bq"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #333333; font-family: inherit; line-height: 21px;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://wordplay.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/11/14/performing-without-a-net/" target="_blank"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Will Shortz writes: “This is David Woolf’s debut. All three 15-letter answers are particularly nice. OSCAR WAO was new to me, but I’ve read up a little on the book since accepting the puzzle, and the entry feels eminently crossword-worthy.”&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;David's Woolf's Crossword Puzzle debut is available in today's New York Times, on newsstands and &lt;a href="http://www.nytimes.com/crosswords/game/2013/11/15/daily/" target="_blank"&gt;online.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a href="http://wordplay.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/11/14/performing-without-a-net/" title="davidrules by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="davidrules" height="247" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3776/10876202573_2b28fe7e1a.jpg" width="357" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;Apologies to my brother who is undoubtably rolling his eyes at my extreme jumping up and down all over the Internet-ness but whoa, am I ever proud to be his sister... today, every day, always.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;DWS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/8679509855889261178/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=8679509855889261178' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/8679509855889261178'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/8679509855889261178'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/11/sorry-i-have-to.html' title='Sorry, I have to...'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-1218584583267492109</id><published>2013-11-14T08:39:00.000-08:00</published><updated>2013-11-14T10:25:31.611-08:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='los angeles botanical gardens'/><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='gardens'/><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='descanso gardens'/><title type='text'>Places to See: Descanso Gardens</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10814189163/" title="photo-11 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-11" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5500/10814189163_b50976630c_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;two roads diverged in a yellow wood and she took neither of them. because the railroad track was far more interesting/dangerous.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;***&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;Over the weekend we spent the day at &lt;a href="http://www.descansogardens.org/" target="_blank"&gt;Descanso Gardens&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;which is absolute heaven. We'd been meaning to go for years and years and then when &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/09/the-joy-brings-itself-i-just-get-my.html" target="_blank"&gt;Heidi mentioned here&lt;/a&gt; I was like OH YES LET'S GO SEE HER PLAY except we totally double booked that day (I am extremely good at doing that) so we decided to head over this past weekend with our favorite "fifth" child, Ryan, who has become as much a part of our family as everyone else in our family. Here are some photos from our day.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10813936925/" title="photo-9 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-9" height="368" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2822/10813936925_41a5f514d7.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10813912635/" title="photo-13 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-13" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3744/10813912635_5a0ab16eac.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10804331224/" title="IMG_3793 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_3793" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3706/10804331224_830647756d.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10813987136/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7384/10813987136_1545685516.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10804247316/" title="IMG_3786 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_3786" height="375" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2810/10804247316_0da5811de1.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10814042154/" title="photo-14 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-14" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3805/10814042154_649a8d22f3.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;I wrote a little more about our day over at &lt;a href="http://gomighty.com/girlsgonechild/descanso-i-hardly-knew-you-and-now-i-love-you-a-lot/" target="_blank"&gt;Go Mighty&lt;/a&gt; if you're interested. &lt;a href="http://patwelsh.com/wpmu/" target="_blank"&gt;My Nana&lt;/a&gt; was friends with &lt;a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchester_Boddy" target="_blank"&gt;Manchester Boddy&lt;/a&gt; back in the day and wrote a really wonderful essay via email so that I could share it with my kids on the way to the gardens. Which is what Nana always does. She writes these beautiful essays about her experiences in Los Angeles and sends them to me and they are TREASURES, all of them. Insightful and hilarious and full of gratitude for having lived in close proximity to so many wonderful characters.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Here's an excerpt:&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;...Among the people I encountered in my early life &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;was Manchester Boddy&amp;nbsp;owner and publisher of the Los Angeles Daily&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;News, a founder of All America Rose Selections and hybridizer of camellias, proteas, &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;and roses. He was also crazy about lilacs, eastern and California ones, and developed&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;some of the early varieties of eastern lilac that would bloom in California. Manchester&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;was a true gentleman through and&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;through but a great businessman. He deeded his La Canada estate to the City of Los&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;Angeles and it became Descanso Gardens, which is open to the public...&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;...We were&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;often together socially, mainly at dinner up at the &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2009/11/treasured.html" target="_blank"&gt;Wright’s&lt;/a&gt; home next door to my house&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;in Del Mar. “Chester,” as he liked to be called, always asked to sit next to me at dinner so&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;he could pump me full of information about plants and gardening. He said&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;that he felt that I would someday have a career in horticulture. Among the many things&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;he taught me was how to prune the roots of camellias and repot them back into the same &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;tubs. Years later when I got on TV, “How to Repot Camellias” was one of the first&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;demonstrations I did on screen...&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;...While I was&amp;nbsp;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;with the magazine (San Diego Home/Garden), I interviewed a man called Howard Asper, who once worked for him.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;Howard was a famous protea expert and I was writing an article on proteas. We&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;reminisced about Manchester and how much we loved him...&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i style="color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;...One of the stories Howard told me was about a&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;time Manchester asked Howard to take a brand&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;new tractor and do some work next to one of the lakes in Descanso Gardens but &lt;b&gt;not to&lt;/b&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;drive it across the land bridge between that lake and the next one.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;Manchester said, “Now don’t drive it over there because the ground is still soft&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;and this new tractor might sink into the pond.”&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i style="color: #5e5e5e; font-family: inherit; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i style="color: #5e5e5e; font-family: inherit; line-height: 21.75px;"&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;Howard was young and didn’t believe him. He remembered how hard they had&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;pounded down that ground a year earlier. He was sure it was thoroughly compacted and&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;on this hot summer day the earth looked hard and dry. He drove the brand new tractor&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;across and it fell into the lake.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;When he told Manchester what had happened, the latter simply said,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;“Okay, go get the old tractor and wade into the pond and hook a chain onto the&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;new one. Then haul out that new tractor and take it to the dump. After you do that, phone&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.45em;"&gt;this number and order another one.”&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i style="color: #5e5e5e; font-family: inherit; line-height: 21.75px; text-align: center;"&gt;“He never even raised his voice,” said Howard. “Now that was a true gentleman...”&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="background-image: none !important; border: none; box-shadow: none !important; box-sizing: border-box; color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px; margin-bottom: 15px !important; padding: 0px; text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10804222425/" title="IMG_3791 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_3791" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7387/10804222425_c809cc7fa3_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10813979116/" style="line-height: normal;" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7355/10813979116_d11c826be1_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10813949866/" title="photo-8 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-8" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2806/10813949866_f4b318dd9c_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="background-image: none !important; border: none; box-shadow: none !important; box-sizing: border-box; color: #5e5e5e; line-height: 21.75px; margin-bottom: 15px !important; padding: 0px; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: black; line-height: normal;"&gt;Botanical gardens are my favorite places to bring my kids. Probably because&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2012/04/revisiting-garden.html" target="_blank"&gt; they were my favorite places as a child&lt;/a&gt;.&amp;nbsp;I may have a brown thumb but my eyeballs will always be green.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: black; line-height: normal;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;(Thank you,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2012/06/eat-plant-well-orchids-are-your-bitch.html" style="line-height: normal;" target="_blank"&gt;Nana&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="color: black; line-height: normal;"&gt;.)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10804254506/" title="IMG_3784 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_3784" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7315/10804254506_f34528c76f_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10806474996/" title="IMG_3687 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_3687" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5493/10806474996_6fe1c44104_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10804500893/" title="IMG_3785 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_3785" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5527/10804500893_cddc6c39f2_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10813899215/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3685/10813899215_c114a51cc0_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10813983566/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5544/10813983566_3affb34f84_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10804390184/" title="IMG_3779 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_3779" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5499/10804390184_9603c8be03_z.jpg" width="480" src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-4789431657045835950</id><published>2013-11-13T09:17:00.000-08:00</published><updated>2013-11-13T10:02:04.891-08:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='eat well'/><title type='text'>Eat Well: Go-To Lunch Salad</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10747879646/" title="IMG_2976 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_2976" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2841/10747879646_01e9b30f6e_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Today's Eat Well (recipe?) will take you three minutes to make and it will fill your body and elevate your mind (not really) and taste delicious. You will need:&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Pre-cooked quinoa (of course)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Raw kale (always)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Avocado (obvy...cado)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;garbanzo beans (I put them on everything)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Seasoning (I like &lt;a href="http://www.amazon.com/Trader-Joes-Everyday-Seasoning-Grinder/dp/B0080M4QPK" target="_blank"&gt;this one&lt;/a&gt;)&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Olive Oil &amp;amp; Balsamic Vinegar (the only way to dress)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Put it all in a bowl. Mix it up. Eat it. The end.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;This bowl of goodness is more or less my lunch every single day. It's also Vegan if that's your thing. (Bo and Revi also dig this action. They will eat the whole bowl including the kale bits which rules.)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;What about you guys? Any go-to lunch recipes that take five minutes or less to throw together? Would love to hear all about them. Extra credit for food that toddlers will partake in as well.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;***&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;P.S. My mom sent me this video yesterday and asked that I share it here along with the following note: "IT REALLY WORKS, EVERYONE!!!!(amillionexclamationpoints)"&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" height="281" mozallowfullscreen="" src="//player.vimeo.com/video/29605182" webkitallowfullscreen="" width="500"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Happy Wednesday!&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link title='Eat Well: Go-To Lunch Salad'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>1</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-3765978030205755631</id><published>2013-11-12T12:08:00.000-08:00</published><updated>2013-11-12T12:08:38.009-08:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='mix tape'/><title type='text'>186/100</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10812557456/" title="chvrches-2-hype-sxsw2013-kaplan by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="chvrches-2-hype-sxsw2013-kaplan" height="333" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3699/10812557456_d834167e4a.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Are you guys bumping&lt;a href="https://www.facebook.com/CHVRCHES" target="_blank"&gt; CHVRCHES&lt;/a&gt; on a loop, too, because HOLY YES TO EVERYTHING SO MUCH AWESOME they rule. Not only is &lt;i&gt;The Mother We Share&lt;/i&gt; my favorite song of 2013 by a landslide, but&lt;a href="http://www.theguardian.com/music/musicblog/2013/sep/30/chvrches-lauren-mayberry-online-misogyny" target="_blank"&gt;&amp;nbsp;this piece on sexism and online harassment, written by frontwoman Lauren Mayberry is a must read&lt;/a&gt;.&amp;nbsp;Cheers to Lauren for speaking out and Chvrches for making such amazing music.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/K_1tzzEQ3DM?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="-webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; color: black; font-family: Times; font-size: medium; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: normal; orphans: auto; text-align: center; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: auto; word-spacing: 0px;"&gt;&lt;div style="font-weight: normal; margin: 0px;"&gt;186. The Mother We Share by: &lt;a href="https://www.facebook.com/CHVRCHES" target="_blank"&gt;CHVRCHES&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="font-weight: normal; margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/3765978030205755631/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-420959297455526467</id><published>2013-11-11T19:35:00.000-08:00</published><updated>2013-11-11T19:41:49.642-08:00</updated><title type='text'>Touching Strangers by: Richard Renaldi </title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10731129506/" title="richard-renaldi-9 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="richard-renaldi-9" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5499/10731129506_2273a72a09_z.jpg" width="508" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I love everything about photographer &lt;a href="http://www.renaldi.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Richard Rinaldi'&lt;/a&gt;s series of photographs of strangers touching, holding hands, hugging one another. It tells all of the stories.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10731129546/" title="richard-renaldi-featured by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="richard-renaldi-featured" height="400" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5518/10731129546_688fbe46c0.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10541123884/" title="touching-strangers-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="touching-strangers-3" height="401" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3833/10541123884_e0f7899115.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10541080685/" title="renaldi_strangers-touching5-thumb-620x348-61976 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="renaldi_strangers-touching5-thumb-620x348-61976" height="281" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3771/10541080685_2d100a382b.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10541105534/" title="6C8403031-ss-130723-touching-strangers-09.blocks_desktop_medium by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="6C8403031-ss-130723-touching-strangers-09.blocks_desktop_medium" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7310/10541105534_ee4ee5c862_z.jpg" width="512" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/SELDTUaHRxQ?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;(For more of Richard Renaldi's work go &lt;a href="http://www.renaldi.com/" target="_blank"&gt;here&lt;/a&gt;.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10541080566/" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7443/10541297113_553cc28607_z.jpg" width="513" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies'     <title type='text'>Girl's Gone Child</title><subtitle type='html'></subtitle><link rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#feed' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/posts/default'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default?start-index=26'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/'/><link rel='hub' href='http://pubsubhubbub.appspot.com/'/><link rel='previous' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default?start-index=1&amp;max-results=25'/><link rel='next' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default?start-index=51&amp;max-results=25'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><generator version='7.00' uri='http://www.blogger.com'>Blogger</generator><openSearch:totalResults>1915</openSearch:totalResults><openSearch:startIndex>26</openSearch:startIndex><openSearch:itemsPerPage>25</openSearch:itemsPerPage><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-2347194157144994453</id><published>2013-11-08T08:57:00.000-08:00</published><updated>2013-11-08T09:50:09.596-08:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='life story'/><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='the spirited child'/><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='spirited children'/><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='she section'/><title type='text'>Rock, Her Gypsy Soul</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10023144336/" title="IMG_8395 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_8395" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7395/10023144336_968d71d850_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Boheme. She was named after/because of/with great respect for&lt;i&gt;&amp;nbsp;she who disregards conventional standards of behavior.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;And, well? She's living up to her name. She's living up to her name in a way that I have been grappling with for the past couple of months when she went from "silly boisterous Bo" to "WHO ARE YOU AND HOW DO I EVEN... WHAT IS HAPPENING? WHY!??? OH MY GOD, SHOULD I JUST LEAVE? HOW ARE WE EVEN... NO. I CAN'T. BUT I HAVE TO. BUT I AM SO TIRED YOU'RE KILLING ME, SMALLS. YOU ARE KILL.ING. ME.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9293762575/" title="IMG_9931 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9931" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7281/9293762575_0c0ecbd727.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;I didn't realize how easy my other kids were until I had a child who wasn't... who &lt;i&gt;isn't&lt;/i&gt;. Bo is more work than Archer, Fable and Revi combined and when I'm alone with all four, it's usually me pulling Bo out of a tree she somehow managed to climb while holding my sunglasses which are now broken all the while her siblings link arms and sing skip-to-my-lou down the sidewalk with halos hovering over their heads.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9666007724/" title="IMG_9638 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9638" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2866/9666007724_d31eec7427_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Bo is the kind of kid who, instead of asking for an apple slice, will push a chair up to the sink, grab a knife and attempt to cut an apple herself. And then when I'm like BO WHAT ARE YOU DOING? She's like, "Oh, hi Mom. I'm cutting an apple with a knife. Want some?"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Bo is known to sneak away and join other families at museums, climb into the laps of strangers and ask them if they have a rash. (She is obsessed with asking people about their rashes because she rashes easily and "rashes" are now her favorite topic of conversation.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Bo's hobbies include standing on tables, bathing Fable's dolls in the toilet, breaking anything that is breakable and hiding in my closet behind my long dresses and then laughing when I (finally) find her because HA HA HA, GOTCHA.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Bo can run faster than her eight year old brother (not to mention, me) and can go days on no sleep without yawning or, you know, taking a breath. She is the last to fall asleep and the first to wakeup and has more LIFE ENERGY than anyone I have ever met.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9709950383/" title="photo-7 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-7" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7313/9709950383_c0a2977caa_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;All of this will serve her well someday. She will eventually find a way to harness her strength in a way that will benefit others, of this I am certain. Because underneath the rough and tumble crazy is an affectionate hugs-for-everyone-let-me-look-deep-into-your-eyes-and-download-the-contents-of-your-soul spirit that blows our everloving minds even though sometimes being her mother/father/sister/brother is a full-time job. (Bo is no longer allowed to go in Archer and Fable's room because she was Bull-in-a-China-shopping the place.) &amp;nbsp;The kids have to keep everything out of her reach and hidden away. Otherwise homework disappears and rainbows get scribbled over and and and and...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10733803303/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="500" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7366/10733803303_010e040416.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Meanwhile, Revi, her mild-mannered roommate (who is completely OCD about her tea parties and organizing every single thing just so in little containers) lives in constant fear of Bo being like, "nice castle that you spent an entire hour building. NOW I WILL BODY SLAM IT AND STEAL YOUR BABY PURSE FULL OF RANDOM OBJECTS AND LOSE ALL OF THEM!"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;On the other hand, Revi has served as a sort guardian angel to Bo's recklessness. Revi is the voice of reason to Bo's HEY, LET'S SLAM THIS DOOR ON EACH OTHER'S FINGERS DOESN'T THAT SOUND FUN AND THEN WE CAN UNLOCK THE GATE AND GO FOR A WALK DOWN THE STREET BY OURSELVES!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;A few weeks back &lt;a href="http://instagram.com/p/gBDZcFLATq/" target="_blank"&gt;I posted a little bit about our struggle on Instagram&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;(&lt;a href="http://instagram.com/p/gBDZcFLATq/" target="_blank"&gt;these comments&lt;/a&gt; are amazing, btw. As are &lt;a href="http://instagram.com/p/gBsxbrrAey/" target="_blank"&gt;these&lt;/a&gt;.)&amp;nbsp;and since it seems many of you are going through the same kind of AHHHHH as it pertains to your "spirited" child, here are some things that have helped me stay sane in the wake of... well... Bo's wake, AKA ten ways we are currently surviving (and occasionally thriving) life with our overwhelmingly insane/beautifully unique/completely amazing/wild child. &lt;i&gt;&amp;nbsp;ED: This is what works in our household and is in no way expert information.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;Ten Ways We Survive the Wrath of Bo&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;1. &lt;b&gt;Give her jobs - &lt;/b&gt;The other day I realized that if I gave Bo a Dustbuster and told her to "vacuum the hallway" she would do so with joy and excitement until said Dustbuster ran out of electric charge. This is also a metaphor.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9910394356/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5446/9910394356_c305a25243.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;2.&lt;b&gt; Create quiet times in the day - &lt;/b&gt;This is a PC way of saying that&lt;b&gt; television is our friend.&lt;/b&gt;&amp;nbsp;Revi couldn't care less about television but Bo will sit and watch an entire movie without moving. INTO IT.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;3. &lt;b&gt;Present her with Options.&lt;/b&gt; &lt;b&gt;(No yes/no questions.) &lt;/b&gt;Asking Bo "if she wants &lt;i&gt;to sit down in her chair&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;instead of &lt;i&gt;stand on the table&lt;/i&gt;" is passive aggressive at best and OF COURSE she wants to stand on the table. Duh. So... here's how we do: "Bo? You can either A. sit down and eat your dinner, B. not eat your dinner at all. OR C. stand over here and wait until everyone is finished eating and eat your dinner alone which might be kind of boring. What'll it be, sister?"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;4. &lt;b&gt;TIME OUTS = OUT TIMES&lt;/b&gt;&amp;nbsp;A while back I was told that "timeouts" aren't ideal punishments because they "alienate" children. Okay, well you know what? I disagree. Sometimes we all need "out time" and kids don't typically put themselves on notice. Not Bo, anyway. (Archer has always put himself in time out. Even at age two, he would go into his room and close the door if I got angry with him. Which is why I'm a tried and true believer in timeouts. Because Archer is my parenting guru and he used them on himself and they worked. BAM.) So? Timeouts are a thing in our house. Especially for Bo who is in timeout AT LEAST once a day. And every time she emerges a new woman. She understands that this is her time to regroup and even though there is no lock on the door and she can open it herself, she doesn't. She yells at me and kicks the floor and after five minutes or so, I ask her if she's ready to &lt;i&gt;try this thing again&lt;/i&gt; and she says, "Ohhhhhkaaaaaaay."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;(Revi has been known to break her sister out of timeout in which case I usually "look the other way" because I think it's important, given their own conflicts, to band together at my own expense sometimes.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;5. &lt;b&gt;Applaud behavior that is satisfactory. &lt;/b&gt;If Bo lets me put a sweater on her without a fight, &amp;nbsp;hands over Fable's toothbrush nicely without throwing it, shares the wagon with Revi on her own I go bonkers with happiness. ROUND OF APPLAUSE FOR DOING SOMETHING COMPLETELY RATIONAL! This way, she doesn't feel like the only time she gets attention is when she does something... not rational.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;6. &lt;b&gt;Dance parties - &lt;/b&gt;I've said it before and I will say it again, here. Dance parties are good for morale. We also have a "GOOOOOO, BARF!" family chant-thing we do when the kids are fighting. Because WE ARE ALL ON THE SAME TEAM, YOU GUYS.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10194934915/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="375" src="http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8134/10194934915_192c6a9828.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;7. &lt;b&gt;Never Make an Empty Threat - &lt;/b&gt;It is a bad idea to make threats anyway but even worse, when the threat is empty. "I'm going to take away your treat if you don't sit down" and YOU BEST BE TAKING AWAY THE TREAT. Otherwise, nothing will mean anything ever again. Parents who cry wolf = parents who cry.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Words mean EVERYTHING. (Unless, of course, they mean nothing in which case, everything falls apart.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;8. &lt;b&gt;Be outside as much as possible - &lt;/b&gt;Some kids (and adults) just need to take it outside. Where the air is clear and the space is open and there are fewer breakable objects.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10296234334/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5511/10296234334_981bfdfd81_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;9. &lt;b&gt;Pick your battles, man. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;You don't want to wear shoes to play in the backyard? Fine. You don't want to wear shoes to the park? We will not be going to the park. Giving children (especially a child like Bo) room to make her own decisions from time to time can be empowering for everyone involved.&amp;nbsp;&lt;i&gt;I respect your voice, now you respect mine &lt;/i&gt;style.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;10.&amp;nbsp;&lt;b&gt;Embrace the Tao of Tantrums. &lt;/b&gt;I look forward to tantrums with enthusiasm because when they end (which they undoubtedly do) the sky will clear and Bo will breathe a sigh of relief for having gotten all of THAT out of her system. (I used to do the same thing when I was Bo's age. I'd have the most epic tantrum ever and then, afterwards, would tell my mom, "I feel much better now.")&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Sometimes, we just have to get it out and move on.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9730444278/" title="IMG_4848 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_4848" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3810/9730444278_f35881d897_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Every day I remind myself that we all have our strengths and weaknesses and at certain times our strengths become our weaknesses, our weaknesses our strengths. Bo is going to set the world on fire in a way that I will no doubt be proud of. It is my job to hold her hand until she holds mine back. To tell her no until she figures out how to find that word in her own bag of tricks.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;In the meantime, friends with "spirited" children, I remain your comrade in the battle of wills. May the force be with us all&lt;i&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/gVAnlke_xUY?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/2347194157144994453/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=2347194157144994453' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/2347194157144994453'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/2347194157144994453'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/11/rock-her-gypsy-soul.html' title='Rock, Her Gypsy Soul'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-2741555461897345749</id><published>2013-11-07T08:54:00.001-08:00</published><updated>2013-12-02T09:23:28.650-08:00</updated><title type='text'>TOTW: Burnish Initial Necklace (&amp; Giveaway) </title><content type='html'>&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10711790785/" title="IMG_1377 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_1377" height="500" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2840/10711790785_db8c3a18c5.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;This isn't the first time I've posted about &lt;a href="https://www.etsy.com/shop/burnish" target="_blank"&gt;Burnish &lt;/a&gt;and it may not be the last because of all the things, my initial necklace (which I have not removed in two years) is by far the item of wear I am asked about most. As it should be. Not only is it the perfect initial necklace, it's also affordable and Rebekah (who runs Burnish) is amazing. (My necklace broke a few months after I bought it and she kindly repaired it for me for free.) Beyond all that, it's understated, elegant, can be worn 24/7, looks good on its own, paired with another necklace, a thousand necklaces, etc.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10712729595/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3695/10712729595_3e3f798480_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Henceforth, I am pleased to offer a giveaway this week of &lt;a href="https://www.etsy.com/listing/90784392/gold-initial-necklace-four-4-letters?ref=shop_home_active" target="_blank"&gt;ONE monogrammed disc necklace&lt;/a&gt; (like mine) with up to FIVE initial discs AND coordinating &lt;a href="https://www.etsy.com/listing/162272518/small-discs-gold-earrings-simple?ref=shop_home_active" target="_blank"&gt;disc earrings&lt;/a&gt;. Pretty, right?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10711873124/" title="IMG_1392 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_1392" height="500" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2824/10711873124_fc6ba8ff37.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;+&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10712067653/" title="IMG_0944 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0944" height="500" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7356/10712067653_9d49ff752f.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;To win? Leave a comment below. And while you're at it, I would LOVE to know if GGC is loading faster for you today than it was yesterday. (I pulled some media from my sidebar/header yesterday after hearing from many of you that you've had issues loading this page. I would love to confirm that GGC is no longer crashing computers/giving anyone trouble. Thank you!) I'll pick one winner (at random) next Thursday, Nov14th.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;P.S. Rebekah at &lt;a href="https://www.etsy.com/shop/burnish" target="_blank"&gt;Burnish&lt;/a&gt; is also offering 15% from now until November 28th (Thanksgiving) with the code GGC2013. Go &lt;a href="https://www.etsy.com/shop/burnish" target="_blank"&gt;here&lt;/a&gt; to shop/check out her amazingness.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;Love to all.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;UPDATED&lt;/b&gt;: Congrats to Sarah KS for winning the necklace &amp;amp; earrings and thanks to everyone for participating!&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/2741555461897345749/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=2741555461897345749' title='10 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/2741555461897345749'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/2741555461897345749'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/11/totw-burnish-initial-necklace-giveaway.html' title='TOTW: Burnish Initial Necklace (&amp; Giveaway) '/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>10</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-7862749500466562894</id><published>2013-11-06T10:19:00.000-08:00</published><updated>2013-11-06T10:39:47.342-08:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='eat well'/><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='date nut bread'/><title type='text'>Eat Well: Memorable Dates</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;The following post was written by my mom, WWW. Thanks, mom!&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10700599524/" title="IMG_0954 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0954" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7430/10700599524_d07228bf06.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;A childhood memory can suddenly appear at the weirdest time, like an old friend   popping in for an unexpected visit. It can be triggered by a smell, a taste, a   conversation, or something we see or read. This happened to me the other day when   I was &lt;a href="http://www.theparkdaleplayers.com/" target="_blank"&gt;at work&lt;/a&gt;. We are doing a musical about dancing through the ages, and when   we started blocking the rock and roll scene, the kids had a lot of questions. “What   are saddle shoes? And bobby socks? What’s a 45?” Pat, my partner, told the kids   all about saddle shoes and bobby socks and how she used to wear them with pedal   pushers, white blouses, and cute scarves around her neck. “45s were small records that had an A side and a B side," I explained. "The A   side was the hot new song that was, or would hopefully become, a hit on the radio,   and on the B side was a lesser known song by the same artist.” The kids all looked   at me blankly. “What’s a record?” one child asked. And suddenly we were telling   them about portable record players, radio stations, American Bandstand, and the   beginnings of rock and roll. “My dad wouldn’t let us play rock and roll records at   home,” I told them. “We only listened to show tunes, classical, and music from the   30’s and 40’s in my house.” And this is when the memory slipped in unannounced. I   was suddenly 6 years old, the year was 1962, and we were visiting my grandparents   in Bucks County, Pennsylvania. My sister and I had gone to their neighbors’ house   and were sitting on the top bunk of one of the kids’ beds. “She-e-rry, Sherry Baby…”   blared from a portable record player and I’d never heard anything like it. The next   song was The Monster Mash and by the time they put on Flying Purple People Eater,   I was hooked. This was my introduction to rock and roll and a couple of years later I   would have pictures of George Harrison plastered all over my bedroom walls.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jBql7tRbTKI/UnqIHd2pXQI/AAAAAAAAFhk/lZ2iUKLEvtw/s1600/george-harrison-9.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"&gt;&lt;img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jBql7tRbTKI/UnqIHd2pXQI/AAAAAAAAFhk/lZ2iUKLEvtw/s1600/george-harrison-9.jpg" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;"&gt;When I got home from work, I found on the Internet that Sherry and The Monster Mash were both released in 1962, corroborating my memory. (The Purple People Eater came out a few years earlier, but was obviously still a favorite.) And then I started remembering other things we did that summer…catching fireflies in jars, running in the woods behind my grandparent’s house, and munching on date nut bread spread with cream cheese under their weeping willow tree. I loved this treat—the combination of the sweet bread and salty cheese was heaven. I don’t   think Gran made her date nut bread from scratch. As I remember, she loved the   sticky moist version made by Van de Kamp so much that she stopped making her   own. That’s the brand my mother bought, too. Years later when I went back east to   meet Larry’s family for the first time, I once again ate date nut bread with cream   cheese at his grandmother’s house—and hers was homemade.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10712076463/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="500" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5531/10712076463_2b12f80c16.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Belle's recipe&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: left;"&gt;Grandma Belle   always kept some of her famous date nut bread in the freezer and after we were   married, she would hand us a loaf to take home when we visited her. And she did   the same for all 15 of her other grandchildren.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Yesterday I found a recipe that mimics the Van de Kamp recipe of my youth and   decided to make it as well as Grandma Belle’s. I made them both with Pamela’s   Artisan flour and wasn’t sure how they would turn out with the gluten free flour.   Right when I had just sliced and spread them both with home made dairy free   cream “cheese” to sample, my friend Lorraine dropped by. She has been recently   diagnosed as gluten and dairy intolerant and is struggling with figuring out how to   adjust her recipes since she is a huge foodie and fabulous cook and baker. Lorraine   couldn’t eat the Van de Kamp date nut bread since I had used butter but she gave   Grandma Belle’s gluten free date nut bread with the dairy free cream cheese a huge   thumbs up as did I. And the Van de Kamp recipe? One bite sent me back again to   1962. No weeping willow to sit under this time—just two girls sitting at a kitchen   table, talking and munching on the sweet, moist bread.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Grandma Belle’s date nut bread is more traditional cake-like loaf with chunks of   dates throughout whereas the Van de Kamp style cake is a uniform loaf—soft,   dense and moist. Both are delicious.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10700526205/" title="IMG_0979 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0979" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7421/10700526205_7f317e0e7e.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;Van de Kamp on left, Belle's loaf on right&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;You could cut down the sugar to ½ cup and   substitute the butter with applesauce if you want a no dairy version. (You can   also substitute the egg with applesauce. The rule of thumb is to replace butter   1:1 with applesauce and substitute each egg with ¼ cup of applesauce.) I HIGHLY   recommend using Medjool dates for both recipes. They are the best dates. In fact,   you probably don’t have to soak them in boiling water since they already are so   gooey!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;b&gt;Grandma Belle’s Nut and Date Bread&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;10 oz. pitted, chopped dates (preferably Medjool)&lt;br /&gt;1 cup boiling water with 1 tsp of baking soda dissolved in it&lt;br /&gt;1 cup sugar&lt;br /&gt;1 egg, beaten&lt;br /&gt;2 cups all purpose flour&lt;br /&gt;1 tsp baking powder&lt;br /&gt;a pinch of salt&lt;br /&gt;½ cup chopped walnuts&lt;br /&gt;Juice and rind of ¼ lemon or more (I did ½ a lemon)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;- Preheat oven to 350&lt;br /&gt;- Grease and flour a nine inch loaf pan&lt;br /&gt;- In a large bowl, pour boiling water over dates and let stand until cool.&lt;br /&gt;- When   cool, beat well with 1 up of sugar.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;- Add beaten egg and beat lightly (by hand).&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;- In   a separate bowl, combine baking powder, flour and salt.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;- Add dry mixture to wet   mixture and mix well. Add lemon, lemon rind, and walnuts and stir.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;- Pour into loaf pan and bake at 350 for one hour.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10700581494/" title="IMG_0978 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0978" height="375" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2867/10700581494_460c89dcab.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;b&gt;Date-Nut Bread (Like Van de Kamp’s, above right)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;From &lt;a href="http://www.waynesthisandthat.com/cook.htm#dessert breads" target="_blank"&gt;Wayne Schmidt’s Cooking Page&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;4 oz. moist, fresh, pitted dates, chopped (preferably Medjool)&lt;br /&gt;1 cup water&lt;br /&gt;1 cup packed light brown sugar&lt;br /&gt;4 tbsp butter, melted&lt;br /&gt;1 egg, beaten&lt;br /&gt;½ tsp salt&lt;br /&gt;1 tsp real vanilla extract&lt;br /&gt;½ cup walnut pieces&amp;nbsp; &lt;br /&gt;1 1/3 cup unbleached flour (or &lt;a href="http://www.pamelasproducts.com/products/baking-mixes/artisan-flour-blend/" target="_blank"&gt;Pamela’s artisan flour blend for gluten free bread&lt;/a&gt;)&amp;nbsp; &lt;br /&gt;½ tsp baking powder&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;- Preheat oven to 325&lt;br /&gt;- Combine the dates and water in a blender and puree until smooth.&lt;br /&gt;- Pour into a large   mixing bowl and add the salt, vanilla, brown sugar, egg and melted butter.&lt;br /&gt;- Beat   with a mixer on low until smooth.&lt;br /&gt;- Mix in the walnut pieces.&lt;br /&gt;- Combine the flour and   baking powder in a separate bowl and then stir this into the wet mixture. Only mix   until the batter is smooth.&lt;br /&gt;- Pour into a greased 8x4 inch bread pan and bake for 60-  70 minutes in a 325 degree oven. &amp;nbsp;(A toothpick should come out clean when inserted   into the middle of the loaf.)&lt;br /&gt;- Remove from the oven and cover immediately with   aluminum foil tented so it doesn’t touch the top of the loaf.&lt;br /&gt;- Cool for one hour before   slicing.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10700769723/" title="IMG_0981 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0981" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5513/10700769723_c885117503.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;b&gt;Dairy-free cream “cheese”&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;1 ½ cups raw cashews&lt;br /&gt;water for soaking&lt;br /&gt;1/3 cup water&lt;br /&gt;The juice of 1 lemon&lt;br /&gt;¼ teaspoon salt or to taste&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Soak cashews for a few hours or overnight. Drain well. Combine with 1/3 cup   water and lemon juice in a high-speed blender and blend until smooth.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10700591954/" title="IMG_0965 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0965" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2809/10700591954_07a4ee68b9_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Add more   water or lemon juice if needed. Add salt to taste. (You can add lemon peel or a little nutmeg to it if you want.) Spread on date nut   bread and enjoy!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10700760893/" title="IMG_0987 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0987" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5499/10700760893_0c67cbe712.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;Love,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;nbsp;WWW&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/7862749500466562894/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=7862749500466562894' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/7862749500466562894'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/7862749500466562894'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/11/eat-well-memorable-dates.html' title='Eat Well: Memorable Dates'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><media:thumbnail xmlns:media='http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/' url='http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jBql7tRbTKI/UnqIHd2pXQI/AAAAAAAAFhk/lZ2iUKLEvtw/s72-c/george-harrison-9.jpg' height='72' width='72'/><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-5443496804341667200</id><published>2013-11-05T10:27:00.002-08:00</published><updated>2013-11-14T21:18:57.790-08:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='mortified nation'/><title type='text'>"Take what was once your shame and own it..."</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10693669433/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5488/10693669433_af23990b87.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;If you haven't heard of &lt;a href="http://www.getmortified.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Get Mortified&lt;/a&gt; before,&lt;a href="http://mortifiednation.com/" target="_blank"&gt; please go here and relish in the awesomeness that is teen angst on display&lt;/a&gt;. (Think TED talks in reverse AKA former teenager/adults who saved their journals and aren't afraid to read them aloud even though they're totally awful and embarrassing and, yet, TOTALLY relatable because most of us were assholes when we were teenagers. And I say that with the utmost love.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10693471664/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7458/10693471664_c1251db7bb_z.jpg" width="479" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Me @ 14&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Get Mortified's catchphrase = ANGST WRITTEN and indeed it is. Indeed everything written in a journal is to some degree.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Today, after years of organizing Mortified shows, the &lt;a href="http://mortifiednation.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Mortified Nation&lt;/a&gt; documentary is being released into the world. Here's the trailer:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="300" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/x3DmdV9XByY?rel=0" width="520"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;And, because I happen to have saved every journal I ever put a pen to from 1st grade on, I decided to share a couple of entries with you today because they're insane. And kind of awesome in this very raw, THIS IS WHO I WAS TYPOS AND ALL way. I have hundreds of journal entries and two entire notebooks devoted to "speeches and presentations" including break-up speeches, "screw you for dumping me" speeches and my personal favorite, a "speach" called "Youth Today and its Relation to Partying , Drugs, Alchohol, &lt;i&gt;Ect,&lt;/i&gt;" which I gave to my mother after I got into trouble for hanging out behind 7-11 where marijuana was being smoked, Zima was being sipped and Dead Kennedys were being blasted from the boom box. (I wrote my mom a lot of crazy letters over the years.&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2010/06/twenty-nine-years-mother.html" target="_blank"&gt; This one still wins&lt;/a&gt;, I think.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br class="Apple-interchange-newline" /&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/pVyX0dQ_zGc?rel=0" width="420"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;And here lies a journal entry describing a typical summer afternoon, hanging with my BFF, pretending to be a stripper, buying a "car" with my hard-earned "money" and 11:11 make a wish. (I have no idea why the sync is off on these videos. I tried to fix it and then I gave up.)&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/RM1MwK_BDmI?rel=0" width="420"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Please feel free to laugh/not laugh and/or share&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt; your own "&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;Mortified" video/post link in the comments below in order to win a collection of motley things. They are:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;1. A signed copy of Rockabye&lt;br /&gt;2. Assorted Fragrances by &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/06/scents-and-sensibility-2.html" target="_blank"&gt;Demeter&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;3. Drawings by: Archer &amp;amp; Fable&lt;br /&gt;4. My favorite &lt;a href="http://evolutionofsmooth.com/ultra-moisturizing-shave-cream-2706.html" target="_blank"&gt;shaving cream&lt;/a&gt; that I buy in bulk because I always run out of it.&lt;br /&gt;5. An old CD from my high school collection. (Anything but The Stealing Beauty Soundtrack. That one's mine 4 lyf.)&lt;br /&gt;6. A surprise from the "take home" table at Hal's work.&lt;br /&gt;7. A children's book chosen at random from our bookshelf. &lt;br /&gt;8. Maybe something else. I have no idea. This list is insane as is so I'll stop.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'll choose one winner next Wednesday, November 13th. Don't forget to read WITH FEELING! Let's do this! Can't wait to hear your words!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10693480546/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7319/10693480546_bf5d56a13b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;It's time to OWN THAT SHAME, PEOPLE! Or, if you prefer, &lt;a href="http://mortifiednation.com/" target="_blank"&gt;watch others own theirs&lt;/a&gt;. (Mortified Nation is available to watch today in the US, UK, and Canada, on&lt;a href="http://mortifiednation.com/" target="_blank"&gt; iTunes, Amazon, and other E-tailers.&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;UPDATED:&lt;/b&gt; Congrats to Donna, Justine and Jori for being such amazing sports and submitting Mortified moments! You will all be getting a care package of random items you will hopefully enjoy.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;80085,&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml'
