CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-866235483008983815</id><published>2013-11-01T20:34:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-11-01T21:40:31.534-07:00</updated><title type='text'>Our So-Called Halloween</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604476126/" title="7Y7A1183 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1183" height="800" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5495/10604476126_4b33581f3c_c.jpg" width="527" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;i&gt;Angela + Jordan FOREVER&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;If you hadn't noticed, we are Halloween people. Mainly because I'm a Halloween person and everyone else just sort of goes along with it because they're nice. This year's costume was an idea I've had for nineteen years but took until Wednesday to actually commit to. By Wednesday night I had our costumes set, Frozen Embryo's T sharpied and was giving Hal's "hooker wig" an Angela Chase bob.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614806176/" title="photo-23 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-23" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3735/10614806176_20a0cd8865_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;(I cut my wig, too. Apparently they do not sell short haired wigs without bangs in Los Angeles.)&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604516036/" title="7Y7A1170 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1170" height="800" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5532/10604516036_30f609d1fd_c.jpg" width="534" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604486165/" title="7Y7A1174 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1174" height="800" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7379/10604486165_08280e6d5a_c.jpg" width="534" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604428025/" title="7Y7A1186 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1186" height="800" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7371/10604428025_e729be59e0_c.jpg" width="534" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Bo refused to wear &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/happy-halloween-love-itsy-bitsy.html" target="_blank"&gt;her spider costume&lt;/a&gt; so I decided to bring her in on our theme party. HENCEFORTH and may I present to you, THE BRILLIANT Brian Krakow!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614918744/" title="photo-7 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-7" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7347/10614918744_37512dbc47_z.jpg" width="481" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614876485/" title="photo-9 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-9" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5499/10614876485_c01540b329_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10615134363/" title="photo-11 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-11" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5509/10615134363_5288617a58_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Brian kindly lent his book to Angela who was like, "thank you. I'll return this to you later," and of course, forgot... but then Brian was like, "MY BOOK! YOU NEED TO GIVE IT BACK" so Angela totally gave the book back while Jordan held Brian in his arms.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604671183/" title="7Y7A1188 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1188" height="800" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7400/10604671183_67125de435_c.jpg" width="534" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;Meanwhile...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10615086213/" title="photo-18 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-18" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3677/10615086213_5b41e3d187_z.jpg" width="464" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;(poor Jordan.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I always hoped that Angela and Jordan would end up together and NINETEEN YEARS later, I would like to share what I know about the unrequited love of Angela Chase and Jordan Catalano.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604710573/" title="7Y7A1180 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1180" height="354" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5503/10604710573_e29850eda4.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;... They got pregnant. They had some babies. (Brian was totally cool with it. He ended up with Sharon Cherski and they have two children and a dog. Rayanne Graff is now a masseuse in Nashville. Enrique (Ricki) Vasquez is happily married and lives in Silverlake.)&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604723223/" title="7Y7A1177 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1177" height="333" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2876/10604723223_6003a6acc7.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Ang and Jord are totally weird for each other, even after all these years.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604502756/" title="7Y7A1176 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1176" height="333" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2806/10604502756_17df5d3253.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Sometimes Jordan gets super romantic and serenades Angela with &lt;a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lVpAWS3ZB5o" target="_blank"&gt;the song that was ACTUALLY about her all along. (Not his car.)&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614831954/" title="photo-22 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-22" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3719/10614831954_cf7dfc9155_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10615095213/" title="photo-17 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-17" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7333/10615095213_f804c57401_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614803925/" title="photo-20 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-20" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7450/10614803925_f13e65e2be_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10615102853/" title="photo-16 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-16" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7406/10615102853_c8164460b0_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10615061053/" title="photo-24 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-24" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2881/10615061053_d0f8863dc9_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614838065/" title="photo-15 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-15" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3686/10614838065_6c44cd87c3_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614810145/" title="photo-19 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-19" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3679/10614810145_e2b109efd5_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;"My job here is done."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;...After which, he ALWAYS apologizes for being a dick at Pike Street that one night.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614832464/" title="photo-21 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-21" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3707/10614832464_e556132054_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;"I'm sorry I was a dick at Pike Street."&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614871626/" title="photo-14 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-14" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3750/10614871626_1188f34f81_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;"Jordan. I'm, like, totally over it. My lips feel permanently frosted," Angela says, removing a small leaf from his hair.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604428546/" title="7Y7A1192 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1192" height="333" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3717/10604428546_306e11ff61.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Jordan smiles.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And then... he plays his guitar.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Again.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;For her.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;A new song this time.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;A new &lt;i&gt;old &lt;/i&gt;song that... well... he doesn't remember the words, really. Not like he used to.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/ckG75Ur50lQ?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;****&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604631003/" title="7Y7A1198 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1198" height="800" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2807/10604631003_931523eeda_c.jpg" width="552" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;If I could put them in a jarrrrr. I know they wouldn't scarrrrr...&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604509755/" title="7Y7A1164 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1164" height="333" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3741/10604509755_0ac13324d7.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;i&gt;I'd do it if I could. I hope you know I woullllldddd.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10604524795/" title="7Y7A1161 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="7Y7A1161" height="368" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5507/10604524795_aea51d74a5.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;(ANNNNND dance by the light of the moon.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10620348046/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2852/10620348046_d1a8e3c57b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;A huge thank you to our friend&amp;nbsp;for taking many of the photos included in this post. You're the beston,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://laszlokovacs.tumblr.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Preston&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' type='text'>The Rainbow and the Spy</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614776095/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3698/10614776095_71bd1ebaa1_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;This is post two of three in a trio of Halloween posts I did not intend to post but this was my favorite year in terms of costumes and most of that had to do with the fact that Archer and Fable were so opinionated about what they wanted to wear and who they wanted to be and that is just the coolest thing to witness, I feel.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Archer held up a picture of a spy from his favorite book series (Big Nate) and said, THIS! THIS EXACT SPY! So I found an old jacket and picked up a hat and a face mask at the party store and we cut a hole in a newspaper and voila: Archer SPYsaacson AKA "the spy from Big Nate."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614877836/" title="photo-13 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-13" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3754/10614877836_ee1140918d_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;Fable (not surprisingly) wanted to be a rainbow.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So when I happened upon &lt;a href="http://www.chasing-fireflies.com/over-the-rainbow-costume/productinfo/32926/" target="_blank"&gt;this costume&lt;/a&gt; I shrieked with HOLY WHOA THIS EXISTS WHAT!??? high-pitched YEEHAWWWW! (And yes, it's typically way more than I spend on a Halloween costume but IT'S A RAINBOW DRESS. It will be worn and loved in perpetuity.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614923244/" title="photo-6 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-6" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7414/10614923244_747cbee99c_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614939894/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3740/10614939894_7989e2f39c_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;DOUBLE RAINBOW!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10615479746/" title="IMG_1936 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_1936" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3671/10615479746_48a8fa11b6_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;(I bought it in a larger size so that she can wear it as much as she wants for as long as she possibly can.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10615447546/" title="IMG_1931 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_1931" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5541/10615447546_9c67e6bc03_z.jpg" width="442" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;The cloud arm puffs came with the costume and I bought the sun headband and the necklace separately. (The jewels were purchased from Michaels. I wore some to the Camp Mighty Space party, channeling Fable of course, who then channeled me channeling her and back and forth forever channel channel channel.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10615515364/" title="IMG_1143 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_1143" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3712/10615515364_e7e583d44a_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614900905/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3717/10614900905_6bf61ac158_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10615475485/" title="IMG_1930 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_1930" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5479/10615475485_79c7a79655_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Fable's strap tore halfway through the night and Archer ditched the mask and the newspaper soon after we left the house but HOLY FUN NIGHT. All four kids were old enough to trick-or-treat together sans stroller, Revi with her eight spider legs and her tiny voice that went. "Tee Oh Tee!" in a sort of exclaimed whisper.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Meanwhile, Bo kept falling on her face (exhaustion) only to pop up and say, "I OKAY! I OKAY! NO BOOBOOS!"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;(Meanwhile, at one point she was bleeding profusely out of her hand.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"Bo! You're bleeding!"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"I okay though! I okay."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Twas a truly epic evening...&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614937826/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2853/10614937826_6936cdf381_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10614952934/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5507/10614952934_7e35481f52_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;ED: Several of you asked where Bo and Revi's spider costumes came from and&lt;a href="http://www.halloweencostumes.com/toddler-polka-dot-spider-costume.html?PCID=21&amp;amp;utm_source=googleps&amp;amp;utm_medium=PPC&amp;amp;utm_campaign=PLA-All&amp;amp;gclid=COSxxMnPmroCFQHZQgodTwsA_g" target="_blank"&gt; I ordered them from here.&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;(They're on &lt;a href="http://www.halloweencostumes.com/toddler-polka-dot-spider-costume.html?PCID=21&amp;amp;utm_source=googleps&amp;amp;utm_medium=PPC&amp;amp;utm_campaign=PLA-All&amp;amp;gclid=COSxxMnPmroCFQHZQgodTwsA_g" target="_blank"&gt;super sale&lt;/a&gt; right now for obvious reasons!)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/8215218031899082373/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=8215218031899082373' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/8215218031899082373'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/8215218031899082373'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/11/the-rainbow-and-spy.html' title='The Rainbow and the Spy'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-5444407823818060304</id><published>2013-10-31T14:30:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-31T14:38:28.018-07:00</updated><title type='text'>Happy Halloween! Love, Itsy &amp; Bitsy</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10596980634/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5534/10596980634_508d7ce6a5.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;The Itsy Bitsy Spider&lt;/i&gt; is Bo and Revi's favorite song. They call it "Itsy Bitsy" so it was kind of a no-brainer when ordering their costumes.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;"Do you guys want to be Itsy &amp;amp; Bitsy, Spiders for Halloween this year?"&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;"Yahhhhhh!"&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Bo wore her costume for a whopping three seconds and I had to bribe her with a cookie to keep it on.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: instead of "Revi" which &amp;nbsp;suits her I think.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10597513974/" title="photo-2 by on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5478/10597498585_17234ec989_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;(I suddenly feel very inspired to write an "Adventures of Bitsy the Spider" book as a sort of PSA in support of spiders &lt;a href="http://kissingmatters.com/eight-reasons-to-love-spiders-or-at-least-spare-them/" target="_blank"&gt;andnotkillingthemassoonasyouseeone&lt;/a&gt;. After all, spiders&lt;i&gt;&amp;nbsp;are &lt;/i&gt;the superheroes of the insect/arachnid set.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10596977506/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5540/10596977506_da21157a60.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Happy Halloween!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/5444407823818060304/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=5444407823818060304' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/5444407823818060304'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/5444407823818060304'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/happy-halloween-love-itsy-bitsy.html' title='Happy Halloween! Love, Itsy &amp; Bitsy'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-5147454262927747778</id><published>2013-10-30T20:10:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-30T20:20:03.431-07:00</updated><title type='text'>riding the last train, patching in the rain</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10542302924/" title="IMG_2093 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_2093" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7342/10542302924_fea94c7f6a.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;After last week's pumpkin patch human-overload we're on a crowd-diet. The kids are actually more than fine with life in a sea of people but Hal and I are like, &lt;i&gt;uhhh... I feel like I'm going to die &lt;/i&gt;in large crowds so we've been more thoughtful with our plans.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Saturday we took the kids to Griffith Park to ride the train (which we hadn't done in years) right as they were closing shop. There were two train rides left and we took them both. It was chilly and the day was nearly done and the light was beautiful and we all bundled together and waved to the ponies and the cars and the buses and the grass and all of the things we passed on our little mission.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578057786/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5532/10578057786_58305c7d8d.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;We exited the train to what appeared to be a post-apocalyptic farm/world which was exactly what the doctor ordered.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10542298894/" title="IMG_2095 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_2095" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3748/10542298894_eca17d90ba_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10542289904/" title="IMG_2094 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_2094" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3790/10542289904_06deb3b0dd_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;We had a ball in the car and some snacks so we decided to kick the ball around for an hour with a little boy who, along with his mother, were the only people besides us left on earth.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578091175/" title="photo-7 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-7" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5480/10578091175_370959025c_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578189064/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7379/10578189064_6a6d6ec3b3_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578152464/" title="photo-8 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-8" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7419/10578152464_d24b00529b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Then, on Monday, we followed our abandoned amusement park scene up with a trip to the local pumpkin patch just as it was starting to rain.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578065456/" title="photo-19 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-19" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5505/10578065456_05d90fc76b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;It was empty and a little drizzly so we spent most of the time with the goats and chickens...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578352623/" title="photo-11 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-11" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3795/10578352623_9ce943ce13_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578338693/" title="photo-13 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-13" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5501/10578338693_4737b1ff77.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;...and in and out of the tipi.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578032085/" title="photo-17 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-17" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2805/10578032085_6e91be04a0_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;It was totally lovely and our new mantra for holiday-crazyeverythinglife this 2013 season now = Arrive late. Embrace rain. Can't lose.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578159956/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5503/10578159956_98799a9963_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578328263/" title="photo-15 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-15" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5520/10578328263_14014cc8df_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10578173104/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3739/10578173104_66e33042cf.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/5147454262927747778/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=5147454262927747778' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/5147454262927747778'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/5147454262927747778'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/riding-last-train-patching-in-rain.html' title='riding the last train, patching in the rain'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-1634691192719975171</id><published>2013-10-29T09:26:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-11-04T13:41:38.771-08:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='life story'/><title type='text'>Time is an Architect </title><content type='html'>&lt;i&gt;The following post was sponsored by &lt;a href="http://www.universalpictures.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Universal Pictures&lt;/a&gt; and their new film &lt;a href="http://www.abouttimemovie.com/" target="_blank"&gt;About Time &lt;/a&gt;which is one I highly recommend going to see. (ED: I was not paid to endorse the film. I really did love it. Was not expecting to, honestly. Four stars.)&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10446358614/" title="IMG_9991 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9991" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7388/10446358614_e147d28c72.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;I have just returned home after dropping Bo and Revi's preschool application off at the school they will begin attending this summer. Last time I did this was with Fable. I was pregnant with the twins at the time so the tugs were less fierce. I&lt;i&gt; will do this again, someday&lt;/i&gt;, said the voice. The voice said the same thing when I signed Archer up for preschool years before. But not now. Today we pull up the rear, hook the caboose to the rest of the cars that in a matter of months will pull out of the station and onto the tracks.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;i&gt;I recently started noticing wrinkles around my mouth in pictures. I notice them around my eyes, too, so I started doing this thing where I smile without moving my mouth too much. Because if I do smile for real I look... old. This is new and although I sort of anticipated that at some point it would happen, I did not expect to wake up... changed.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;Time is an overnight success that way. One day you just look older.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;And then the next day you look that way still and you&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;nbsp;can't wash it out like a bad hair day or cut sugar for the week or whatever.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10446428825/" title="IMG_0777 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0777" height="500" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3751/10446428825_21fc8480a2.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;He stands against me with his head almost to my chin.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"When did you get so tall?" I ask him.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"When did you get so short?' he says back.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And I wonder if in the same way I think he's growing he sees me shrinking. Like, OH, you're a human, actually. You don't know the answers to all the problems. You don't even know how to help me with my math homework.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And he's right. I don't. I was always terrible at math and he knows that now. He knows all of the things I struggle with.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"When did you get so short?"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"When did you get so perceptive?"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;We aren't supposed to like the way we look when we age.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;We are told in our ears and our eyes &amp;nbsp;to see age as a flaw worth battling.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;nbsp;Tear down and rebuild. Remodel. Remove. Redefine. What if instead of defying age and fighting our faces, we joined them and worked together? Sat down and had a conversation with the changes and the transitions and said, "hey! You scare me and make me feel different. Let's discuss over foods that are good for us and then take a walk and keep discussing?"&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10446366924/" title="IMG_9960 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9960" height="500" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7332/10446366924_cf84f6b2ae.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I do not realize that they're aging in fast forward until we run into someone we haven't seen in a few weeks or a month or a few months. "I barely recognized her!" they say. "They're so big!"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;They're so big.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;They're so big.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;But they're not so big also.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And that's the part I am choosing to see at the moment. The smallness of this phase. The tiny fingers and the little boots I can hold in one hand. The little slide being a huge thrill. The moment. That's the wonderful part about the caboose. About knowing that this is it. That this is the last of the toddler years... I can savor these days. Well, most of them, anyway. Some days do not deserve to be savored and yesterday was one of them and I was very happy to wake up the next day and have us all a little older.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;i&gt;My hair was blonde my whole life until one day I decided to dye it black. I spent four years with short black hair until I got pregnant with Archer and let it grow out and into its natural color. It has looked the same ever since, give or take a haircut. My hair was blonde and then it was black and then it was brown and that in itself is a story. The great compromise of nature and nurture is something I regularly think about in all aspects of my life. The compromise between concealing and sharing, changing and staying the same. I am a natural blonde who colored her hair black once and is now a brunette. That defines everything for me. I am the sum of my natural and unnatural selves. Light/dark. Push/pull. Compromise.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10446415205/" title="IMG_9942 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9942" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3736/10446415205_eb38f1bd70.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;My first idea for this post was to write about all the times in my kids' childhoods I wish I could revisit. And then I thought, &lt;i&gt;but if I went back in time, I would miss all of what's happening now.&lt;/i&gt;&amp;nbsp;And I want what is happening now to keep happening. Archer's writing books, you guys. He wrote a ninety page book and he's working on another and it's called "The Archer and The Three Strong Sisters" and I want to read every word and be here for him if he has a question about a verb. Because where I cannot help with math, I can with this. I want to watch Fable create elaborate rainbow dresses and witness Revi sneak into Bo's timeout session to rescue her. (That happened yesterday. Bo was in timeout and Revi went into their room, took her sister by the hand and snuck her out into the hallway all the while whispering, "Hi, Bobo. Hi. Bobo, hi. Hi, Bobo.") All of this. ALL OF THIS. This is where the action is.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Everything else is frozen. Still. A puppet without a hand.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;My second idea for this post was to write about a time I wished I could revisit. A moment in my life I could return to in order to improve it with the knowledge I have now as someone older and wiser and... older. Like those heartfelt letters everyone writes to their teenaged or twenty-something selves. And then I realized I had no moment. I don't have any advice to my new parent self. All of the ways I failed and succeeded and said the wrong things and tripped and fell and lied and tried ... but not very hard, mattered.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;My mistakes more than anything. &lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;I wouldn't have &lt;b&gt;not&lt;/b&gt; broken up with &lt;b&gt;him&lt;/b&gt;, or stayed away from &lt;b&gt;her... &lt;/b&gt;I would have still&amp;nbsp;&lt;b&gt;backed my car into my dad's Pontiac the day I got my license&lt;/b&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;All of those moments, those failures and missteps, brought me to this: A boy writing a book next to his sister drawing a rainbow next to a pair of whispering toddlers, sneaking markers out of the box and into a tiny metal shopping cart Bo will soon push off the steps and watch crash.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;"Uh oh," she'll say. "Again!"&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10446392624/" title="IMG_0548 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0548" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3715/10446392624_8df1dc9e66.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;This is what is happening now. At age thirty-two. Bo pulled her diaper off during a nap and Revi refused to go to sleep with her hair NOT in pigtails and Fable needed me to tuck in her eyeballs for the tenth time and Archer couldn't sleep because "what if there's a universe just like ours and we're all just someone's thoughts and we're living in a universe that is actually a dream?" and one of the walls in our house needs to be replaced because of a leak that's been happening for years and right now there's a hole the size of my body in the hallway and all of our home's insides are just there on display- pipes and wood and brick... &amp;nbsp;and the moulding is caving in around the front door so we have to go out the side door and Hal and I are laughing at something that we won't think is nearly as funny tomorrow and we're all out of whole milk so we drink our hot chocolate with soy which I used to love and now think is gross.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;I recently got invited to try a new age-defying body wrap skin thing that supposedly takes years off your skin and inches off your waistline and fights age with hundreds of dollars and lasers and creams and wraps so tight you can't breath. It was free for me in exchange for a post and I thought about it for a minute before saying no. I look at my mother who is strikingly beautiful with her gray hair and aging face, her calloused fingers and never-before-waxed brows. She is what aging is supposed to look like and I look to her in the same way my daughters will look to me. No matter how many spreads of Kate Moss I plastered to my ceiling in high school, the woman I saw in the flesh most of all was my mother. Regardless of how many airbrushed advertisements are plastered over my daughters' psyches, my body is the one they see in front of them every day. In the flesh. Scarred and badly tattooed, with sagging navel and upper arms that triple in size when I press them against my sides.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Bo and Revi don't start preschool until next summer which in this moment feels like a lifetime away. And that's because it is. Life is long. It's so long I can count it in decades.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;Life is short. It's so short I can count it in months.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;When people say "youth is wasted on the young" I think of caterpillars.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;When people say "fight the effects of aging" I think of butterflies.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And I smile.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;As the lines continue to draw themselves with their pencils.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;Time is an architect.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;2.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;And I'd rather live in an old and storied house. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10463946904/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3830/10463946904_ef37dbc64b.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/-bugCwPpP9o?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' fate&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10541112464/" title="il_570xN.231923880 by girlsgonechild, on href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10541071065/" title="il_570xN.405949116_cghv by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="il_570xN.405949116_cghv" height="500" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7456/10541071065_a7af551fbc.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.etsy.com/listing/117767186/they-built-a-life-out-of-hope-and?ref=shop_home_active" target="_blank"&gt;they built a life out of hope and flowers&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10541075836/" title="il_570xN.390706839_orwm by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="il_570xN.390706839_orwm" height="496" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2862/10541075836_a750e1c813.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.etsy.com/listing/113736358/julians-imaginary-friend-kept-him?ref=shop_home_feat" target="_blank"&gt;julian's imaginary friend kept him company at parties&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10541075496/" title="il_570xN.405992511_ac3t by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="il_570xN.405992511_ac3t" height="399" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2866/10541075496_ab1b29405b.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.etsy.com/listing/117779272/she-carried-with-her-the-sea-limited?ref=shop_home_feat" target="_blank"&gt;she carried with her the sea&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10541629883/" title="il_570xN.403752206_r38f by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="il_570xN.403752206_r38f" height="500" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3775/10541629883_40f269964c.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.etsy.com/listing/117162139/everything-was-as-it-should-be-limited?ref=shop_home_active" target="_blank"&gt;everything was as it should be.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Amazing, right? I have &lt;a href="https://www.etsy.com/listing/84372625/fine-art-print-of-original-oil-painting?ref=shop_home_active" target="_blank"&gt;this print&lt;/a&gt; hanging above my desk at home and I love it so. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;For more on Amanda Blake go &lt;a href="http://www.amandablakeart.com/" target="_blank"&gt;here&lt;/a&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br
