type='text'>last minute halloween ideas. or not. </title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10470321613/" title="4065353128_b03330dc4d_b by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="4065353128_b03330dc4d_b" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7403/10470321613_ae3cc65fc6.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Since everyone else is doing it, I thought I'd jump in and recommend some couples/family costume ideas that may or may not work for you and yours based on the last seven years of throwing stuff together at the very last minute.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Circus Family: Illustrated Man, Conjoined Twins, Bearded Lady&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/285514213/" title="Siamese Twins, Bearded Biotch. Illustrated Man by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Siamese Twins, Bearded Biotch. Illustrated Man" height="320" src="http://farm1.staticflickr.com/114/285514213_f011cd2f71.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;You will need:&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;- temporary tattoos + iron on letters + tank top + pants for baby + cape?&lt;br /&gt;- a balloon&lt;br /&gt;- facial hair for lady&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;(I trimmed my bangs and stuck them to tape which was gross but very real-looking.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/285514207/" title="Freak Love by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Freak Love" height="320" src="http://farm1.staticflickr.com/111/285514207_8c6fd2405b.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/285502036/" title="Halloween Hallway by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Halloween Hallway" height="320" src="http://farm1.staticflickr.com/101/285502036_2bbe31bb2c_o.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2007/11/we-are-halloween-and-so-can-you.html" target="_blank"&gt;Ernie, Bert &amp;amp; Rubber Ducky&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/1814975834/" title="Family Portrait by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Family Portrait" height="375" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2050/1814975834_5ab1a28a78.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;You will need:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;-Two ugly sweaters&lt;br /&gt;-some stick-on mustaches for unibrow&lt;br /&gt;- a stick on beard (for top of head, preferably bald)&lt;br /&gt;- a wig&lt;br /&gt;- a duck costume (or something that looks like a duck?)&lt;br /&gt;- iron on letters if you want to iron-on some letters&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/1814139109/" title="Bert and Ernie by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Bert and Ernie" height="395" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2263/1814139109_e7ef96e972.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/1814129209/" title="Bert and Ducky by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Bert and Ducky" height="375" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2390/1814129209_d1806895df.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: x-small;"&gt;(Archer looks exactly like Revi here. I see their resemblance most of all.)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;***&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2009/11/halloween-part-wtf-of-two.html" target="_blank"&gt;Going as Each Other&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/4065366966/" title="Untitled by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Untitled" height="375" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2504/4065366966_63ac18972a.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;You will need:&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;to trade clothes.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/4065228980/" title="Untitled by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Untitled" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2677/4065228980_b2821457cd_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/4065243254/" title="Untitled by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Untitled" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2615/4065243254_eacd147e0e_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;(and a bald head thing if your significant other is bald.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/4065219378/" title="Untitled by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Untitled" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2642/4065219378_4e1c666f17_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/4064609097/" title="Untitled by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Untitled" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3039/4064609097_66deb5efe1_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;***&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2010/11/cant-spell-halloween-without-hal.html" target="_blank"&gt;Katy Perry &amp;amp; Elmo&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: x-small;"&gt;(kind of dated but that makes it funnier?)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/5134626847/" title="IMG_9224 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9224" height="375" src="http://farm5.staticflickr.com/4069/5134626847_03f131064f.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/5134628153/" title="IMG_9221 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9221" height="375" src="http://farm5.staticflickr.com/4018/5134628153_6943c4e3b7.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;This one required a bit of work. I had to buy Hal a wig and a lady's fairy costume and a veil and also an Elmo Costume which, yeah. More work than usual but worth it. I mean... hi.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/5135221890/" title="IMG_9271 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9271" height="640" src="http://farm5.staticflickr.com/4108/5135221890_f3941115e5_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YHROHJlU_Ng" target="_blank"&gt;The Katy Perry/ Elmo&lt;/a&gt; "controversy" is long passed and I'm trying to think of something similarly controversial but I got nothing. Perhaps you can go as Miley and the Foam Finger? (Hal and I were going to go as &lt;a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Bowl_XXXVIII_halftime_show_controversy" target="_blank"&gt;Janet Jackson and Justin Timberlake a la Superbowl 2004 &lt;/a&gt;because &lt;i&gt;how quickly we forget, right? &lt;/i&gt;But then we decided it was way too much work and nobody would get it and it was just funny to us. Which is probably how it is every year.)&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/5134630661/" title="IMG_9212 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9212" height="640" src="http://farm2.staticflickr.com/1153/5134630661_09bae52bec_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;***&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2011/10/happy-halloween-love-jolie-pitts.html" target="_blank"&gt;The Jolie-Pitts&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/6301274873/" title="Halloween with the Jolie-Pitts by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Halloween with the Jolie-Pitts" height="640" src="http://farm7.staticflickr.com/6047/6301274873_76bd42c3ed_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;This one was my all-time favorite because it was a night-before throw-together and I don't think I have ever laughed so hard as I did when my &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2011/10/happy-halloween-love-jolie-pitts.html" target="_blank"&gt;dad snapped these photos&lt;/a&gt; of us. (Sleep deprivation makes everything more hysterical.)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/6301273907/" title="P1011330 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="P1011330" height="640" src="http://farm7.staticflickr.com/6220/6301273907_5baa79da6f_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/b&gt;(Brad Pitt circa "Snatch")&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/6301803714/" title="P1011299 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="P1011299" height="640" src="http://farm7.staticflickr.com/6219/6301803714_735b45f49f_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;You will need:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;a marker&lt;br /&gt;some wigs&lt;br /&gt;several children/newborn twins/dolls&lt;br /&gt;men's clothes&lt;br /&gt;a black dress&lt;br /&gt;a baby bjorn&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/6301270555/" title="P1011348 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="P1011348" height="375" src="http://farm7.staticflickr.com/6238/6301270555_c8f32a779b.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/6301269007/" title="P1011355 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="P1011355" height="375" src="http://farm7.staticflickr.com/6215/6301269007_9d07457951.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/6301267121/" title="P1011368 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="P1011368" height="375" src="http://farm7.staticflickr.com/6240/6301267121_a1f07a7276.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;***&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Last year we went as&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2012/11/liner-notes-halloween-edition.html" target="_blank"&gt;&amp;nbsp;a Mother of four/Father of Fore&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;which was pretty whatever. This year we have no plans but a whopping six days to figure it out.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;How about you guys? Any awesome thrown-together last-minute ideas or links to websites with ideas? I assume most of us are pretty last minute about Halloween, yes? I feel like it sneaks up like a mofo every year and suddenly it's like, "ahhhh! overnight express the princess costume which is three sizes too big but oh well!" xo&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/1625209041403213328/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=1625209041403213328' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1625209041403213328'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1625209041403213328'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/last-minute-halloween-ideas-or-not.html' title='last minute halloween ideas. or not. '/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-654378551198176787</id><published>2013-10-24T21:48:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-24T21:50:16.914-07:00</updated><title type='text'>Next Generation... of Singing Dancers?</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10446386874/" title="IMG_0885 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0885" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5545/10446386874_7bdfd31bff_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;As mentioned yesterday, I spent last weekend at Camp Mighty. I was there on behalf of &lt;a href="http://thenextgeneration.org/" target="_blank"&gt;Next Generation&lt;/a&gt;/&lt;a href="http://www.clintonfoundation.org/" target="_blank"&gt;Clinton Foundation&lt;/a&gt;'s &lt;a href="http://toosmall.org/" target="_blank"&gt;Too Small to Fail campaign &lt;/a&gt;who I am honored to be teaming up with these next few months on a sponsored campaign with &lt;a href="http://gomighty.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Go Mighty.&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I'll be &lt;a href="http://gomighty.com/user/girlsgonechild/" target="_blank"&gt;creating goals for myself&lt;/a&gt; to do&amp;nbsp;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;with my kids and the first two&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;are these:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;- &lt;a href="http://gomighty.com/goal/38315/" target="_blank"&gt;Help Fable turn her Power Pocket Prototypes&lt;/a&gt; into a set of Power Pocket belts for boys and girls who "are a little shy and in need of some power to be less shy" much like &lt;a href="http://instagram.com/p/fvAK4MLAVS/" target="_blank"&gt;the one she made for herself&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;br /&gt;- &lt;a href="http://gomighty.com/goal/38312/" target="_blank"&gt;Join a music class to attend with Bo and Revi&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;...Which brings me to this: one of the few things we do every night as a family, together, is sing. My mom used to say the same prayer to me every night as a child and to this day it is one of the things I hold most dear.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It went like this:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;Where do fairy Beccas lie&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;'til they're old enough to fly&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;here's a likely place i think&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;amid these stuffed animals, blue and pink...&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;Every. Single. Night.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I don't do a prayer with my kids but &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2012/06/123100.html" target="_blank"&gt;I have been singing the same song every night since Archer was born&lt;/a&gt;. And that song is &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2010/12/brief-history-of-lullabies-78100-79100.html" target="_blank"&gt;Moon River.&lt;/a&gt; ...Or as it's now called, "&lt;i&gt;Bo Revi&lt;/i&gt;" as in "Booooo Reeeeevi, wider than the miiiile..."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;We also make dance parties a regular thing in our house because I find they're good for household morale.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;object classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000" data="http://www.flickr.com/apps/video/stewart.swf?v=137118" height="325" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="500"&gt; &lt;param name="flashvars" value="intl_lang=en-us&amp;amp;photo_secret=201ec24c39&amp;amp;photo_id=10469549214"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name="movie" value="http://www.flickr.com/apps/video/stewart.swf?v=137118"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name="bgcolor" value="#000000"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" src="http://www.flickr.com/apps/video/stewart.swf?v=137118" bgcolor="#000000" allowfullscreen="true" flashvars="intl_lang=en-us&amp;amp;photo_secret=201ec24c39&amp;amp;photo_id=10469549214" height="325" width="500"&gt;&lt;/embed&gt;&lt;/object&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Anyway... I'll be documenting various goals/stories over at&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="http://gomighty.com/user/girlsgonechild/" target="_blank"&gt;Go Mighty&lt;/a&gt; so if you're at all interested, &lt;a href="http://gomighty.com/tag/gomighty4kids/" target="_blank"&gt;here's what's going down&lt;/a&gt;. In the meantime, here's a video with more information about Next Generation/&lt;a href="http://toosmall.org/" target="_blank"&gt;Too Small to Fail&lt;/a&gt;.&amp;nbsp;(You can also&lt;a href="http://toosmall.org/About" target="_blank"&gt; go here &lt;/a&gt;to learn more.)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/pwn0YGKM-Fg?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;P.S. I'd love to hear about some of the ways you spend quality time with your family. Are you big on lullabies? What do you sing to your kids? What are some of your favorite songs to dance to? Do you have before bed rituals?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/654378551198176787/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=654378551198176787' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/654378551198176787'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/654378551198176787'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/next-generation-of-singing-dancers.html' title='Next Generation... of Singing Dancers?'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-1694019451755075299</id><published>2013-10-24T09:21:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-24T09:42:40.467-07:00</updated><title type='text'>"the storyteller is, for better or worse, a life poet."</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10445932753/" title="photo-10 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-10" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2861/10445932753_5599eb9724_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: x-small;"&gt;image via: &lt;a href="http://www.amazon.com/Anderson-Collection-Matt-Zoller-Seitz/dp/081099741X" target="_blank"&gt;The Wes Anderson Handbook&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;I just returned from &lt;a href="http://gomighty.com/camp-mighty/" target="_blank"&gt;Camp Mighty&lt;/a&gt; where a lot was said about story, which is everything when it comes to everything. It made me think of &lt;a href="http://vimeo.com/12793139" target="_blank"&gt;this &lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_McKee" target="_blank"&gt;Robert McKee&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;lecture. And, yes, it's&lt;a href="http://vimeo.com/12793139" target="_blank"&gt;&amp;nbsp;27 minutes long&lt;/a&gt; but worth a watch if you have the time.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I recommend one "parenting" book to friends who are expecting and that book is &lt;a href="http://www.amazon.com/Bird-Some-Instructions-Writing-Life/dp/0385480016" target="_blank"&gt;Bird by Bird,&lt;/a&gt; which isn't a parenting book at all and that's why it's the best one. Because it pertains to all humans with human experiences. (Here are &lt;a href="http://www.goodreads.com/work/quotes/841198-bird-by-bird-some-instructions-on-writing-and-life" target="_blank"&gt;some quotes&lt;/a&gt; if you don't have the book in front of you.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;In fact, pretty much any/all books about &lt;i&gt;writing &lt;/i&gt;can be applied to &lt;i&gt;parenting&lt;/i&gt; because their main objective is to get us, the readers, to &lt;i&gt;just do it. Just write the damn thing. Trust your gut, yo. &lt;b&gt;Write what you know.&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;We are the sum of the stories we read and hear and watch, and the stories we tell and share and give are our greatest legacy.&lt;/span&gt;&amp;nbsp;We tell stories whether through books or our own experiences, when punishing, rewarding, teaching... we use archetypes to bridge gaps in our unknown as we converse, argue, write, read, understand.&amp;nbsp;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;Because we have not experienced it all for ourselves, not even close. So we turn to characters in books, strangers on airplanes, friends in our living rooms, teachers in classrooms, articles in magazines. We recall the story our grandmother told us once. Whatever has left an impression becomes a part of who we are. And then we pass it on.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10446394724/" title="IMG_0062 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0062" height="375" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2884/10446394724_fa8f6bfcb8.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;There are some really great takeaways from McKee's lecture and these (in my opinion) are some of them:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"There is no such thing as an innocent story. Every story contains an idea that is wrapped inside an emotion. Stories take ideas and embed them into people irrationally..."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;"When people get emotional, things change."&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"In order to survive the mind does whatever it needs to keep itself alive. The mind is capable of rationalizing every &lt;i&gt;evil &lt;/i&gt;into a &lt;i&gt;good&lt;/i&gt;... Each and every person in the world who is doing what we think is evil, they think of as good... and then you realize that &lt;b&gt;every one of us is capable of such&lt;/b&gt;..."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"The mind organizes life as a story... in order to understand ourselves and our own existence... which is why we need great storytellers... to give us deep insight into life... otherwise life becomes inauthentic..."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"A decadent life is a mono life - flattened... so we need honest, insightful storytellers to shine a bright light into the dark corners of humanity."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"Aristotle said, &lt;b&gt;a convincing impossibility is to be preferred to an unconvincing possibility.&lt;/b&gt; And this is true especially when you're working with stories based on fact... the actuality must be convincing. Just because it's based on fact DOES NOT MAKE IT TRUE." (ED: &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/09/stories-we-tell.html" target="_blank"&gt;AMEN&lt;/a&gt;.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"... the third way to persuade people is to tell them a story. &lt;b&gt;Story persuades because story admits the negative,&lt;/b&gt; it throws life out of balance in order to then restore balance... positive, negative, positive, negative..."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"&lt;b&gt;When people use rhetoric they hide every fact that contradicts what they say. For example, when someone sells you sex they do not bring up venereal disease&lt;/b&gt;."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"Tell your stories. Tell them from the heart. Tell them as beautifully as you know how... And then ask yourself at the end, do you believe this? Is this an honest expression of what it is to be a human being? Do I believe in the meaning of my own creation? If the answer is yes, then &lt;b&gt;do everything you can do get that story into the world&lt;/b&gt;. "&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="orphans: auto; text-align: center; text-indent: 0px; widows: auto;"&gt;&lt;div style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="281" mozallowfullscreen="" src="//player.vimeo.com/video/12793139" webkitallowfullscreen="" width="500"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt; &lt;a href="http://vimeo.com/12793139"&gt;Legendary Writing Teacher Robert McKee at Thinking Digital&lt;/a&gt; from &lt;a href="http://vimeo.com/thinkingdigital"&gt;Thinking Digital&lt;/a&gt; on &lt;a href="https://vimeo.com/"&gt;Vimeo&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/1694019451755075299/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=1694019451755075299' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1694019451755075299'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1694019451755075299'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/the-storyteller-is-for-better-or-worse.html' title='&quot;the storyteller is, for better or worse, a life poet.&quot;'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-6797350990393977943</id><published>2013-10-23T09:20:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-23T09:50:56.775-07:00</updated><title type='text'>Our Day at The Patch</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="background-color: white; color: #222222; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="color: #1f497d;"&gt;This post is sponsored by Blue Diamond Almonds. Get Your Good Going with&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #1f497d;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #1f497d;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://facebook.com/bluediamondalmonds" style="color: blue;" target="_blank"&gt;Blue Diamond Almonds&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #1f497d;"&gt;!&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416967373/" title="photo-23 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-23" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2882/10416967373_ec20fa5260_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;i&gt;you'd never know it from this picture, but...&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;On Sunday we went to the Pumpkin Patch on the busiest day of the year which I do not recommend for those of you who, like me, are allergic to crowds.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416781694/" title="photo-20 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-20" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2846/10416781694_5072337c2a_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;My parents came with us and Archer's best friend and we met up with my dear friend Polly and her kids and we all were like, "UH... WHUT." because the last time we went to Underwood Family Farms in Moorpark there were fifteen people in the entire place. This was not the case this time around and where kids don't seem to notice these things, the adults in our crew all but decided to leave. (I have never seen so many people anywhere and I'm not just saying that. It was a Disneyland-sized crowd in a much-smaller-than-Disneyland location.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416870886/" title="photo-6 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-6" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5487/10416870886_33b8e0f8f0.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;So? We set off for the "rural wilderness" on the outskirts of human central.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416868076/" title="photo-7 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-7" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3816/10416868076_00fb0a9ef4_z.jpg" width="479" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416810144/" title="photo-18 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-18" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3675/10416810144_b407bc8842_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416949413/" title="photo-21 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-21" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7346/10416949413_5a72450a81_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Ironically, the pumpkin patch itself was completely empty. So instead of hayrides and train rides and panning for gold, we chilled with the pumpkins.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416846034/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3733/10416846034_fa485020e5_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416792174/" title="photo-26 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-26" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5504/10416792174_9f1cdf7fd7_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;... and the scarecrow.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10417078053/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2886/10417078053_6bcf1f952d_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;stacked and arranged...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416816355/" title="photo-27 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-27" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7338/10416816355_ce64087b57_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416839634/" title="photo-8 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-8" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5531/10416839634_55e739bc4b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;We stayed for five hours and skipped naps and only experienced one minor meltdown when we forced the kids out of there at 5:00. Highlights included starting a dance party in a giant plastic pumpkin.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416847734/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="374" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5507/10416847734_d3d303d915.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;"You're gonna hear US roaaaar."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416875375/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7395/10416875375_2d48f06354.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;"There's a party in the USA."&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And a pig race wherein Fable was plucked out of the audience and asked to wave a purple flag in the middle of the thing.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416833784/" title="photo-10 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-10" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7391/10416833784_f3fa0233bd_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416952273/" title="photo-11 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-11" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2815/10416952273_42583d75da_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416999893/" title="photo-12 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-12" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5547/10416999893_d31ddd1301_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div lunch.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416878765/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img afternoon.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10408464274/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" Here is a case study on exhaustion and its effects on two very different two year olds:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10416837384/" title="photo-9 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-9" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5518/10416837384_33839b9a9f_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;Nature &amp;gt; Nurture.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;edited to add: &lt;/b&gt;I am not pregnant. src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-121065940548165077</id><published>2013-10-22T10:07:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-22T10:19:33.041-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='gone style'/><title type='text'>Substance + Style: Dani, 22 Weeks</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10293785883/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5546/10293785883_51b69b7501_z.jpg" width="479" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/08/gone-style-substance-dani-week-13.html" target="_blank"&gt;I wanted to make this a weekly thing &lt;/a&gt;but it ended up being impossible so here we are two months later, past the half-way point and it's all very exciting around here and holy gorgeous pregnant woman, Batman.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10293583614/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3832/10293583614_e11d990e89_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;Dress: Vintage via &lt;a href="http://www.laroseboutique.com/" target="_blank"&gt;LA Rose&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;Sunglasses: vintage&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10293668726/" title="photo-6 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-6" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2851/10293668726_9341fc987b_z.jpg" width="479" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC: DANNIIIIII. You look amazing and I want to kiss you. Tell me about the last two months? What has changed? How is your pregnancy progressing?&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Dani:&lt;/b&gt; I look pregnant. That's the most obvious change! Everything is progressing on track. Just this last week I started feeling little pops. Went from nothing happening all the time. Kinda nuts! Curious what a solid kick will feel like.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;GGC:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;Have you started preparing at all? Nesting? Naming?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #500050;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Dani:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;Nesting in the sense that we are obsessively house hunting so we can actually start nesting. Names have been floating around! I don't always know what to say when friends ask to hear our ideas. Cause the real answer is "no way"! Maybe it's just a bit too early&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10293797763/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5515/10293797763_3c38e496b1_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;GGC:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;What have you been wearing?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: x-small;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Dani:&lt;/b&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;I've been wearing a lot of stretchy or at-least flowy vintage dresses cause they are fun and comfy! I just ordered maternity tights and leggings from h&amp;amp;m that I'll wear soon. I'm enjoying finding stuff that makes me feel good and feminine and that I can wear after the pregnancy too.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;GGC:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;How (if at all) have you been preparing?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: x-small;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Dani:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;I recently talked to a few friends about their complicated traumatic labors and kinda started to freak out. It helped me decide I don't want go the route of reading a ton of books and knowing everything that could go wrong. It's just not for me. I prefer to trust my own instincts going forward and glad I made that re-realization.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC:&lt;/b&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #500050; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;Your baby is the size of a banana this week. How has that changed the way you look at bananas.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #500050;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Dani&lt;/b&gt;:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;I think its actually a carrot or maybe a squash this week. Those vegetables they pick out are so random that I lose track. I just know she (oh ya I found out its a girl!) is almost a pound and 11 inches long!&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;: Let's hear it for the baby girls! Let's hear it for the Dani!&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10293678055/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3783/10293678055_0b5f0af806_z.jpg" width="481" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Because it's Fall pretty much everywhere but Los Angeles. (October and September are our warmest months it seems) I picked some cute seemingly maternity-appropriate dresses that I can see Dani wearing.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10278035544/" title="plugin_rollover_images by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="plugin_rollover_images" height="450" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5515/10278035544_06b707339d_o.jpg" width="372" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.bonadrag.com/index.php?l=product_detail&amp;amp;p=1618" target="_blank"&gt;Mary Meyer Black Aztec&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;$152&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10278125175/" title="image4xxl by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="image4xxl" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7437/10278125175_06827752fa_z.jpg" width="502" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.asos.com/New-Look-Maternity/New-Look-Maternity-Stripe-Longline-Knit-Tunic/Prod/pgeproduct.aspx?iid=3038999&amp;amp;SearchQuery=stripes&amp;amp;sh=0&amp;amp;pge=0&amp;amp;pgesize=36&amp;amp;sort=-1&amp;amp;clr=Navystripe" target="_blank"&gt;long-sleeved striped maternity ASOS&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;
