scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='mix tape'/><title type='text'>183/100</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;Swoon City. Happy Tu(n)esday.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/sqlyIlpV-eA?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;183. Riptide by: &lt;a href="http://vancejoy.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Vance Joy&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10293663875/" title="photo-9 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-9" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2871/10293663875_c72ec89d3f_z.jpg" width="481" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10293553094/" title="photo-10 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-10" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3833/10293553094_8483870ed5_z.jpg" width="481" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/5919512059675965426/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=5919512059675965426' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/5919512059675965426'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/5919512059675965426'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/183100.html' title='183/100'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-5383221205089955858</id><published>2013-10-14T11:12:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-17T09:43:56.386-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='she section'/><title type='text'>"We need more Maps to Manhood."</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10274846426/" title="Untitled by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Untitled" height="500" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7339/10274846426_f98087fce7.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;A few days ago, the following slide was brought to my attention via &lt;a href="https://twitter.com/amirightfolks" target="_blank"&gt;a tweet&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;from &lt;a href="http://stephguthrie.com/blog/" target="_blank"&gt;Steph Guthrie&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;via &lt;a href="https://twitter.com/jeffperera" target="_blank"&gt;Jeff Perera&lt;/a&gt; who regularly speaks about gender roles, specifically, masculinity.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10176903893/" title="Untitled by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Untitled" height="628" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7334/10176903893_02a1ba78b5_z.jpg" width="460" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/2012/05/02/understanding-boys-understanding-girls/" target="_blank"&gt;In Perera's words:&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="background-color: white; border: 0px; color: #707070; font-family: 'Droid Sans', Verdana, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 21px; margin-bottom: 1.154em; outline: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: start; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/2012/05/02/understanding-boys-understanding-girls/" target="_blank"&gt;An interactive portion I present in every talk or session I run with people of any age and walk of life is “What do you like/dislike about identifying as a certain gender” or “What do you like/dislike when people assign a gender to you based on your appearance?” &amp;nbsp;When I ask a younger group the question is usually “what do you like or dislike about being a boy or a girl” (We later discuss how this really isn’t a binary discussion, but your experiences in life are based on how many people will interact with you as either a boy or girl)&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="background-color: white; border: 0px; color: #707070; font-family: 'Droid Sans', Verdana, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 21px; margin-bottom: 1.154em; outline: 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: start; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/2012/05/02/understanding-boys-understanding-girls/" target="_blank"&gt;I asked this group of fifty Grade 4 boys to get into groups and answer the question.&amp;nbsp;Here is the list from one breakout group of those Grade 4-6 boys:&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10175249683/" title="what-i-dont-like-about-being-a-boy by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="what-i-dont-like-about-being-a-boy" height="413" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3687/10175249683_97b6b89e13_z.jpg" width="551" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It reminded me of &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/03/amour.html" target="_blank"&gt;a conversation Archer and I had&lt;/a&gt; about "motherhood." It reminded me of &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/04/we-need-to-allow-men-to-be-sensitive.html" target="_blank"&gt;a conversation Archer and I had&lt;/a&gt; about violence. It reminded me of many conversations Archer and I have had. About not wanting to play a sport. About growing up and what it means to like "boy stuff." And then it made me think of how segregated these conversations are. Like sex ed and how the boys had to leave the classroom when it was the girls' turns to learn about their bodies. How the girls had to leave the room when it was the boys' turn... Because girls and boys bodies worked differently and it wasn't our business learning about the other sex when it came to sex?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #707070; font-family: 'Droid Sans', Verdana, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 21px;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/2012/05/02/understanding-boys-understanding-girls" target="_blank"&gt;...I vividly remember being 12 years old and an adult calling a bunch of us around to join him to drool and&amp;nbsp;ogle&amp;nbsp;at the bra section of the Sears catalogue. We stood around as if participating in a no-frills manhood-rite-of-passage, awkwardly knowing to nod and smile approvingly on cue. Ideas of Social norms and cues come from individuals in our lives as well as from the world around us.&amp;nbsp;While girls struggle to understand how to handle the attention that comes with developed breasts or long legs: Boys struggle to understand what it is that they are supposed to be and not be in romantic, sexual and everyday encounters.&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #707070; font-family: 'Droid Sans', Verdana, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 21px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #707070; font-family: 'Droid Sans', Verdana, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 21px;"&gt;***&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Growing up, I always assumed that girls were the insecure ones. That it was the girls who struggled internally. Because, ironically, the girls were the ones who were talking about their internal struggles. We were allowed to, expected to - we played truth or dare and telephone and all the games that little girls played so that we could share openly with one another.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;I learned later that boys weren't supposed to come to boys' birthday parties &amp;nbsp;in the way girls do, with arms open and dresses pressed and&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;i style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;let's braid each other's hair&lt;/i&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;. Boys don't get invited to girls' birthday parties, either--at least not in our experience. Archer has never been invited to a birthday party by a girl in his class. Not once in four years. Meanwhile, Fable has been invited to four boys' birthday parties SO FAR THIS YEAR. That sends a message.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Even if we don't think it does. And, yes, girls' birthday parties are usually gender specific. But do you know how many boys complained that there was a princess at Fable's party? Zero.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9910300185/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5476/9910300185_6e2dee8a24_z.jpg" width="427" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;i&gt;Bo and Revi with Archer's best friend who is amazing&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;And &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2012/03/on-finally-accepting-feminism.html" target="_blank"&gt;just like having daughters has changed the way I look at myself&lt;/a&gt;, having a son has &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/07/boy-culture-on-masks-and-eye-patches.html" target="_blank"&gt;changed the way I look at boys&lt;/a&gt;. At men. At their struggle. At their emotional complexity and how unfair it is that society tells them repeatedly to hide that away. To bottle it up. To fake it. To act out and show off in order to be accepted. Make friends. Be included. That &lt;i&gt;caretaking is for girls. That affection is uncool.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10274234256/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="500" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3775/10274234256_718f03a646.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/2012/05/02/understanding-boys-understanding-girls/" target="_blank"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="background-color: white; border: 0px; color: #707070; font-family: 'Droid Sans', Verdana, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 21px; margin-bottom: 1.154em; outline: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/2012/05/02/understanding-boys-understanding-girls/" target="_blank"&gt;For the workshops, I delivered almost exactly the same session for the boys as I did for the girls. I talked with the young women about the pressures and expectations placed on boys to walk, talk and act a certain way and how that impacts upon girls and women.&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;I showed them &lt;a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hJZkBWBashA" target="_blank"&gt;a video of spoken word artist Shihan&amp;nbsp;performing Love Like&lt;/a&gt; &lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/2012/05/02/understanding-boys-understanding-girls/" target="_blank"&gt;and we discussed their reactions to seeing a male who is excited and enthusiastic about love and being in love.&amp;nbsp;I asked the girls what would happen to a boy who expressed enthusiasm about love in their school hallways, during recess or in the neighborhood: a boy not trying to play it cool and act all hard, but openly&amp;nbsp;enthusiastic&amp;nbsp;and happy. They said he’d be made fun of. I asked If they would laugh at a boy who acted or felt this way, half of them put their hands up.&amp;nbsp;I asked if this was an example of how they would want their partner ( regardless of sexual orientation) to feel about love and being in love.&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="background-color: white; border: 0px; color: #707070; font-family: 'Droid Sans', Verdana, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 21px; margin-bottom: 1.154em; outline: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/2012/05/02/understanding-boys-understanding-girls/" target="_blank"&gt;All thirty girls put their hands up.&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;I know this is just scratching the surface as usual, and that I've become a bit of a broken record a la "lets empower our sons as well as our daughters", but I found &lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/2012/05/02/understanding-boys-understanding-girls/" target="_blank"&gt;this&lt;/a&gt; so eye-opening, even though I feel like my eyes are pretty open to this subject, so I couldn't not&lt;i&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;pass it on.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;In the words of Jeff Perera, "&lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/2012/05/02/understanding-boys-understanding-girls/" target="_blank"&gt;we need more maps to manhood&lt;/a&gt;."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Or better yet, we need to provide a better landscape from which our sons can draw their own maps. Because &lt;a href="http://www.genderremixer.com/html5/#" target="_blank"&gt;this shit be crazy&lt;/a&gt; on both sides. Because girls perpetuate the myth of masculinity as well. Mothers. Sisters. Evite invitations. Let's please keep talking about this. With our sons AND our daughters and ourselves.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;For more on Jeff Perera go &lt;a href="http://higherunlearning.com/" target="_blank"&gt;here.&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;Also, please check out &lt;a href="http://www.itstartswithyou.ca/" target="_blank"&gt;It Starts With You&lt;/a&gt;, &lt;/i&gt;which is a Canadian organization that rules. (This video is a much-watch for all, I think. Especially children.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/7cvD3zydc08?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;I started a masculinity/raising sensitive sons "boy power" pinterest board, &lt;a href="http://www.pinterest.com/girlsgonechild/boy-power/" target="_blank"&gt;here,&lt;/a&gt; and would LOVE to include any articles, posts, or talks you have to recommend on the subject. Thanks in advance.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/5383221205089955858/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=5383221205089955858' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/5383221205089955858'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/5383221205089955858'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/we-need-more-maps-to-manhood.html' title='&quot;We need more Maps to Manhood.&quot;'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><media:thumbnail xmlns:media='http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/' url='http://img.youtube.com/vi/7cvD3zydc08/default.jpg' height='72' width='72'/><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-8423787536944010180</id><published>2013-10-11T11:45:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-11T12:18:37.613-07:00</updated><title type='text'>Last Friday Night. And Saturday.</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173746503/" title="photo-27 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-27" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7460/10173746503_bacc6739ce.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Hal's parents came out from New York last week and over the weekend we celebrated Fable's 5th with a bounce house and a princess and way too much pizza. I had been regretting the house party idea pretty much since we sent the evite because it's kind of a stressful thing having all of those people in your house, especially when you don't know them really at all. I made the mistake of saying these things out loud in front of Fable and then realized, "CHILL. This is happening and it's going to be rad."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Me: Oh, but the clean-up!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Myself:&lt;i&gt;&amp;nbsp;Every day there's a clean-up!&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Me: Oh but the house gets thrashed and there's not even room and there's stuff everywhere and the windows are basically falling apart and there are spiderwebs everywhere and dust bunnies.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Myself: &lt;i&gt;Look at your daughter's face, woman. She is thrilled.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Me: &amp;nbsp;I'm going to shut up now.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173572735/" title="photo-41 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-41" height="375" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2849/10173572735_e7f0184316.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10194934915/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="375" src="http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8134/10194934915_192c6a9828.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;The anticipation days are always the best. We set up a few days early, moved furniture out of the way and had epic dance parties in the rooms that suddenly had no corners to bonk heads on or couches to hog space...&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173585275/" style="text-align: left;" title="photo-37 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-37" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3763/10173585275_647baca347_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173676146/" style="text-align: left;" title="photo-29 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-29" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3749/10173676146_4185c368f0_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Fable did most of the decorating herself, taping pictures on the walls, creating a playlist with her favorite songs. My father-in-law and I blew up balloons until we felt drunk from light-headedness. (Worth it, though. Balloons are so fun in rooms with no furniture. Like slow everything down as they float uppppppp an doooooooooowwwwn uppppppppp and dooooowwwwn, rolllllllllllll and uppppppp.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173800253/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7398/10173800253_920f37770d_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173742836/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2884/10173742836_ffd18e547d_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;My mother-in-law made Fable an amazing rainbow sweater and brought flower buttons so that Fable could arrange and sew them on herself.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173605665/" title="photo-30 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-30" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2816/10173605665_cbbc4941cd_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173724933/" style="text-align: left;" title="photo-34 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-34" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3734/10173724933_6b57f5d589_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;The morning of her party, Fable was up at 6 am in a wedding dress and a crown her auntie Dani made for her clipped across her head, like, "WAKE UP. IT'S ALL HAPPENING."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173458294/" title="photo-43 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-43" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3801/10173458294_7d58c6f292.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Do you remember that feeling? My earliest memories are my birthday parties, not during them but before, as I sat on the stairs, kicking the wall, picking at my socks, &lt;i&gt;waiting... &amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;Twisting my side-ponytail, turning up and then down the Phantom of the Opera CD which is pretty much all I listened to until I was introduced to Arrested Development and then I just listened to &lt;a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5cHOc5t6yaE" target="_blank"&gt;Mr. Wendal&lt;/a&gt; on repeat for, like, three years.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173672785/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7384/10173672785_e58bdac93f_z.jpg" width="479" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;My mom made 48 cupcakes because she's amazing. We ordered pizza and made lemonade, salads for the parents, seven-layer dip, a bunch of carrots on a plate. Strawberries on a plate. Cucumbers on a plate. Pirates Booty on a... bowl.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173560354/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="640" src="http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8559/10173560354_5147ddd22c_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173622946/" title="photo-47 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-47" height="640" src="http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8400/10173622946_6956a721b5_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;And then, people arrived. And &lt;i&gt;Aurora &lt;/i&gt;arrived. And everyone arrived. And minus a broken window and lemonade spills every sixteen seconds, all was well and awesome. The kids danced and bounced and colored (next time I'm just going to buy a bunch of paper and markers and let them draw pictures for three hours) and Sleeping Beauty rocked it out with the balloon animals and the freeze dance and the face painting...&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173795433/" title="photo-6 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-6" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2893/10173795433_779023b6df.jpg" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173549864/" title="photo-9 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-9" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3784/10173549864_0fd3abffb3.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173715916/" title="photo-12 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-12" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5349/10173715916_d0c8559b8f.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;We went to another birthday party on Sunday for one of Fable's classmates. (Everyone in her class has a birthday between October- December so there's pretty much a birthday party every weekend day) and I realized that even though destination parties are easier and less stressful and all of the things that one appreciates as a parent, there's something really special about a house party, broken windows and all.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173625386/" title="photo-46 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-46" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2809/10173625386_6783382030_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173528054/" title="photo-17 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-17" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7301/10173528054_6d7aa0686e_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10182245873/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7386/10182245873_f01d8ef6a7_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173692473/" title="photo-45 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-45" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3795/10173692473_27c333ee9f_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173553865/" style="text-align: center;" title="photo-23 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-23" height="640" src="http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8264/10173553865_016b304bb7_z.jpg" width="479" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173639615/" title="photo-15 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-15" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7335/10173639615_7b78751bc8_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173443704/" title="photo-48 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-48" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5501/10173443704_c95f0e32a6_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173632515/" title="photo-18 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-18" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3748/10173632515_df4a4527c6_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;"Did you have a good birthday?"&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;"I had a GREAT birthday."&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;"How does it feel to be five?"&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;"It feels AMAZING."&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;... And so goes the end of little lady birthday season.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10182031804/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2871/10182031804_9b8e931d16_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I remember celebrating &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2011/10/fable-luella-birthday-girl.html" target="_blank"&gt;Fable's third birthday days after we brought Bo and Revi home from the hospital&lt;/a&gt;, feeling guilty about the girls' birthdays being so close.&amp;nbsp;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;I mean, obviously Bo and Revi's were going to be close but for Fable, who is in a sense the middle child, having to share everything with two little sisters, including her birthday season, felt, I don't know...&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;i style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;something.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173694796/" title="photo-20 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-20" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5535/10173694796_10ea78efe2_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Which is insane, I now realize and now I kind of love that their birthdays are all at once. It feels like this great big celebration of life. Like three giant waves all in a row and &lt;i&gt;WHEEEEWWWW, what's up, life? We are celebrating the LADIES this month, what's up, ladies! IT'S GIRL PARTY TIME! &lt;/i&gt;And it is, it was, it has been.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173510184/" title="photo-26 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-26" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7298/10173510184_d450e10b7b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;i&gt;... Tic tack toe, Three cupcake dresses* in a row&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10194974606/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7296/10194974606_7d204b8f4c.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10194837464/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5460/10194837464_542d42ba52.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10194972436/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5532/10194972436_cdbe1f59a0.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10173630185/" title="photo-19 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-19" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7356/10173630185_3b6d6dd877_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;i&gt;Until next year...&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: x-small;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;span style="font-size: x-small;"&gt;*dresses were homemade by WWW. &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2010/08/gone-style-fables-homemade-dresses.html" target="_blank"&gt;The pattern info is here&lt;/a&gt; and the &lt;a href="https://www.fabric.com/buy/bj-603/sweet-tooth-cupcakes-turquoisecm_mmc=Google-_-Products-_-Products%20Listings-_-Ads?CAWELAID=172000510000013625&amp;amp;catargetid=172000510000043626&amp;amp;cadevice=c&amp;amp;cagpspn=pla&amp;amp;gclid=CMa61ZSWj7oCFdBxQgodeWQAOQ" target="_blank"&gt;fabric is here&lt;/a&gt;. xo!&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/8423787536944010180/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=8423787536944010180' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/8423787536944010180'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/8423787536944010180'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/last-friday-night-and-saturday.html' title='Last Friday Night. And Saturday.'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-5293615292204039742</id><published>2013-10-10T15:50:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-14T21:39:32.237-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='eat well'/><title type='text'>Eat Well: Good Bones</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;The following post was written by my mom, WWW. Thanks, mom!&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10192896784/" title="IMG_0755 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0755" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7367/10192896784_5726b89cb5.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;It’s been awhile since I have written a blog post and I’ve missed it.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;There have been several reasons contributing to my absence but the main reason is that I have been helping my mother, Rebecca’s Nana, who fell and broke her leg (her femur) over a month ago.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;She had immediate surgery to attach plates and screws to hold the bone in place, and after 5 days in the hospital, has been recuperating in a rehab center. I’m bringing this up because on the day that we brought her to the center, one of the nurses asked if she had taken Boniva or Fosamax, both osteoporosis medicines.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;Yes…she had…for 2 years but stopped taking them several years ago because she had an instinct that they weren’t good for her.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;“You might look into it but we have seen a huge number of broken femurs associated with these drugs,” said the nurse. It turns out that there is a class action lawsuit against the drug companies making osteoporosis medicines because people’s femurs are suddenly breaking…without trauma.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;The drugs, although helping with bone density, are suspected of making bones brittle.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;In my mom’s case, the Boniva or Fosamax might not have contributed to her break.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;She fell on her knee, which is replaced, and the bone cracked. &lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;Because she fell, we can never know if her bone would have stayed in tact if she hadn’t taken the drugs.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;But there is that thought in the back of my mind…. What if?&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;I have talked about The China Study and the subsequent movie, &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/01/eat-well-party-like-its-alkalineyline.html" target="_blank"&gt;Forks Over Knives, here before&lt;/a&gt;. The book made so much sense to me when I read it over 6 years ago that I changed the way I eat. To reiterate, the authors argue, based on 30 years of scientific study, that our chances of contacting “Western” diseases—diabetes, heart attack, many cancers, high cholesterol, and osteoporosis—dramatically decrease if we limit our consumption of animal protein (dairy, meat, and eggs) to less than 10% of our total calorie intake. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;According to the &amp;nbsp;American Journal of Clinical Nutrition&lt;a href="http://www.ecopolitan.com/healtheducation/free-articles/92-milk-strong-bones." target="_blank"&gt; “a high ratio of animal protein to vegetable protein increases the rate of bone loss and the risk of fracture in postmenopausal women” &amp;nbsp;because “dietary protein increases production ofacid in the&amp;nbsp; blood which can be neutralized by calcium mobilized from the skeleton.&lt;/a&gt;"&amp;nbsp;&lt;span style="background: white; color: #494a44; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;A &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background: white; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;National Institutes of Health study out of the University of California, published in the American Journal of Clinical Nutrition (2001), found that; &lt;a href="http://www.ecopolitan.com/healtheducation/free-articles/92-milk-strong-bones" target="_blank"&gt;"Women who ate most of their protein from animal&amp;nbsp;sources had three times the rate of bone loss and 3.7times the rate of hip fractures of women who ate most of their protein from vegetable&amp;nbsp;sources."&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background: white; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;Researcher Dr. John McDougall at Yale University found: &lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background: #FCFCFC; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-style: italic; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;"&lt;a href="http://www.ecopolitan.com/healtheducation/free-articles/92-milk-strong-bones" target="_blank"&gt;On a nation-by- nation basis, people who consume the most calcium have the weakest bones and the highest rates of osteoporosis. ... Only in those places where calcium and protein are eaten in relatively high quantities does a deficiency of bone calcium exist, due to an excess of animal protein."&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;span style="background: #FCFCFC; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-style: italic; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;A couple of weeks ago, I had a bone density test.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;The last time I had one was about 6 &lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;years ago, just before I switched to a plant based diet with some, but very little, dairy and eggs.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;At that time I had osteopenia, the precursor to osteoporosis, so I was interested to find out if my diet change had affected my bone loss. A couple of days after the test, I called my doctor’s office to find out the results.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;“Oh…your bones look great!” the assistant told me. &amp;nbsp;“No osteopenia whatsoever."&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;I told him how I had osteopenia 6 years ago and he looked at my chart to confirm. I then told him that I had changed the way I eat and had switched my calcium supplement from Calcium Citrate to plant-based calcium—that I had read the China Study and it had changed my life.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;“Wow!&amp;nbsp; Have you seen Forks Over Knives?” he asked. “Our whole office watched it together and since then, we are suggesting to our patients to make the changes you made.&amp;nbsp; Whatever you are doing, keep it up!”&amp;nbsp; I was so excited to hear that this office, a very mainstream general practitioner’s office, not only watched the movie but is telling people about it.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;As women, we are at a higher risk for osteoporosis than men.&amp;nbsp; On the high protein western diet, at about age 30, bone mass begins to decline and during menopause, when our bodies stop producing estrogen, our bone loss becomes much worse.&amp;nbsp; The good news is that the damage can be reversed.&amp;nbsp; By increasing our plant-based protein consumption and decreasing our animal protein consumption, we give our bones a chance to stay strong and that means fewer fractures as we age. This doesn’t mean giving up meat and dairy entirely.&amp;nbsp; But decreasing animal protein to a small portion once or twice a day will make a huge difference, and in my case, even at 57, my bone density returned to normal by eating a mostly plant based diet and switching to plant-based calcium supplements.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;It’s easy to get calcium from plants.&amp;nbsp; Many of the same plants that are high in protein are also high in calcium. Collard greens, kale, broccoli (especially the leaves), mustard greens, arugula, okra, and turnip greens are powerhouses of calcium. (Either grow your own broccoli for the leaves or you can find broccoli rabe or other leafy broccoli at farmer’s markets.) Figs, apricots, nuts, beans, soy, molasses, oranges, quinoa, and seeds (such as sesame, sunflower, and chia) have lots of calcium, too.&amp;nbsp; So basically, if you are eating a variety of different plant based foods, you will be eating a calcium rich diet.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;I rarely ate kale before my switch, and now it is a staple in our diet.&amp;nbsp; It is a powerhouse of calcium and other vitamins and minerals.&amp;nbsp; &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2010/07/eat-well-www-says-eat-your-veggies.html" target="_blank"&gt;Ages ago, I did a post on kale chips&lt;/a&gt;, but I think it is a good time to re-examine this delightful way of eating kale.&amp;nbsp; I’ve also since then played around with different ways of preparing it.&amp;nbsp; You can either roast the kale in a hot oven, which is fast but also can burn the kale, or you can cook at a lower heat for longer.&amp;nbsp; I experimented last night with several temperatures and flavorings, and both Larry and I agreed that we preferred the kale cooked at a lower temperature. You can have fun trying different seasonings and oils—my friend Liz likes avocado oil, which gives it a slightly avocado flavor.&amp;nbsp; Also truffle oil is delicious. &amp;nbsp;Sprinkle with salt and a little sugar, or add smoked chipotle, cumin, nutritional yeast, or other flavorings of your choice. Anyone who doesn’t like kale will be an instant convert with presented with a plate of Krispy Kale!&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Krispy Kale&lt;/b&gt;&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;"&gt;1 bunch curly kale&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;"&gt;about 2 tablespoons olive oil &lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;"&gt;salt or seasoned salt of your liking (I use &lt;a href="http://www.etsy.com/shop/VitalSalts?ref=search_shop_redirect" target="_blank"&gt;my favorite VitalSalt sesame truffle salt&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;"&gt;pinch or two of sugar (optional)&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Wash and DRY kale well (the oil won’t stick to it unless it is dry).&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;Tear leaves into about 3 inch pieces, saving the stems for other uses. Toss in a bowl with about 2 tablespoons of oil of your choice.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10193026535/" title="IMG_0747 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0747" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3716/10193026535_ecd7df586e.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;Massage oil into kale with your hands so that the oil is coated on the leaves. Toss with salt to taste.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;Spread in a single layer on parchment-lined baking sheets.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10192919084/" title="IMG_0749 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0749" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3683/10192919084_a184ef371d.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Bake for about 10 minutes and then turn kale over.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;Bake for another 5-10 minutes, checking frequently.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;The kale is best when crisp but not brown.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;Pour kale in a bowl and toss with a pinch or two of sugar, if desired. (I love it this way!!)&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10193042276/" title="IMG_0751 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0751" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7331/10193042276_e87fc3afeb.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;optional flavorings: cayenne pepper, smoked chipotle, cayenne pepper, nutritional yeast (add before or after baking)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;You can eat these as a snack or sprinkle them on&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;a favorite entrée or salad.&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Next time I am going to try and make kale chips by using a dehydrator.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;I’ll let you know how that turns out.&lt;span style="mso-spacerun: yes;"&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;Meanwhile, I’d love to know if you have a favorite way of preparing crispy kale!&lt;/i&gt;&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;"&gt;Enjoy! And may your bones be healthy forevermore.&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;"&gt;Love,&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;!--[if gte mso 9]&gt;&lt;xml&gt;  &lt;o:Company&gt;Girl's Gone Child&lt;/o:Company&gt;  &lt;o:Lines&gt;61&lt;/o:Lines&gt;  &lt;o:Paragraphs&gt;17&lt;/o:Paragraphs&gt;  &lt;o:CharactersWithSpaces&gt;8702&lt;/o:CharactersWithSpaces&gt; src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3822/10191849004_de987a62e2_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;...And they decided to make "apples" in the kitchen. And also a cake.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10191972286/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3770/10191972286_26802117c0_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;(Which was delicious.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10191977456/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2883/10191977456_108fc73b85_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10191948765/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3791/10191948765_0f6764491b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;Fin.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10191920105/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5479/10191920105_8c80371e27_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/5144834036847055320/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=5144834036847055320' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/5144834036847055320'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/5144834036847055320'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/wooden-sandwich-on-stoop.html' title='Wooden Sandwich on the Stoop'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-6026015508167202961</id><published>2013-10-09T09:01:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-09T09:04:32.367-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='mix tape'/><title type='text'>182/100</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10159602955/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3828/10159602955_cae4b23e58_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;I was listening to &lt;a href="http://thisisfirstaidkit.com/" target="_blank"&gt;First Aid Kit&lt;/a&gt; on my headphones Monday morning when First Aid Kit walked into the cafe I was writing in and proceeded to order food. And then I sat there stunned and crazy-eyed as I smiled at Klara like an idiot and she... smiled back. Kindly. &amp;nbsp;I wanted so badly to say something but in the moment I just... couldn't. It all seemed too coincidental and surreal so instead instead I just sat there, frozen, typing the same three words over and over for thirty minutes as their music played in my ears and they talked amongst themselves on the other side of the counter.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Until, finally, they got up to leave and I panicked because OH MY GOSH THIS IS MY LAST CHANCE TO SAY SOMETHING so I leapt out of my chair and made the following proclamation in a language that was mostly made-up.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"HKJAHYUYYOUAREAMAZINGILOVEYOURMUSICSOMUCHUIUYIAHYJKH."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And then they smiled and said thank you and then I turned around and walked into the bathroom and closed the door and hid.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Which, two days later, I am still regretting.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I wanted to say more. I wanted to tell them the story of how I was listening &lt;a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sz952swREd8" target="_blank"&gt;to this song&lt;/a&gt; when they walked in. I wanted to buy them a coffee or breakfast... a cookie for the road. As a token of thanks. Because so many times their music has brought me peace and &lt;a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QiNNZMKOQoI" target="_blank"&gt;their voices &lt;/a&gt;have taken my breath away.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And I'm sitting here totally regretting not having said those things or done those things or, you know, &lt;i&gt;acted like a proper human being&lt;/i&gt;.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;They were extremely gracious in the face of my rambling nervousness. And it made me love them infinitely more if that's even possible. So I'm posting another (two) of their songs even though I've posted songs by them&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2012/03/113100-114100.html" target="_blank"&gt;&amp;nbsp;before.&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;If you needed another reason to support this band, here's what: they're the real deal, lemon peel. They win all the prizes.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/3huNmrJScJs?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;(Also, watching this video makes me realize that I'm not alone in my bumbling awkward run-away-to-the-bathroom-omgwhatismyproblemawkwardness when it comes to the&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;span style="background-color: white; line-height: 24px;"&gt;Söderberg&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: Georgia, serif; font-size: 15px; line-height: 24px;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;sisters. Phew to that.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/ir10In7xv9Q?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;182. Our Own Pretty Ways &amp;amp; Waltz for Richard by: &lt;a href="http://thisisfirstaidkit.com/" target="_blank"&gt;First Aid Kit&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/6026015508167202961/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/6026015508167202961'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' title='182/100'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-8604999525343939703</id><published>2013-10-07T11:34:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-17T08:51:35.358-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='gone style'/><title type='text'>For Sale, Baby Clothes, Gently Used</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;The following post was sponsored by &lt;a href="http://www.moxiejean.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Moxie Jean&lt;/a&gt;, an online consignment store for children.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10140887466/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2820/10140887466_7918b8cdea_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I posted about &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/04/for-love-of-hand-me-downs-sponsored.html" target="_blank"&gt;Moxie Jean in the Spring &lt;/a&gt;and Bo and Revi are still wearing the pieces &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/04/for-love-of-hand-me-downs-sponsored.html" target="_blank"&gt;I ordered for them then.&lt;/a&gt; Even if they don't... fit... as well.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10140940493/" title="photo-7 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-7" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3691/10140940493_68dba9d8c5_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I cannot part with this blue jumper pictured above. It is my favorite thing Bo has ever worn, even though it's become more like an ill-fitted onesie these days. (ED: Revi refuses to wear it because she says it's Bo's, which is becoming a bit of a problem because Bo has a good five pounds and almost two inches on Revi so Revi SHOULD BE getting Bo's hand-me-downs. Except she gets super mad at me when I attempt to put something on her that she associates with her sister. &lt;i&gt;Hysterical&lt;/i&gt; mad. (Is this a twin thing? Bo doesn't seem to care either way btw. But Revi? Pulls a "NO, MAMA! DIS BOBO'S!" with every other article of clothing.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10140829515/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3732/10140829515_a7b0fcf3f7_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;...&lt;span style="text-align: left;"&gt;Which is a little bit heartbreaking.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/04/for-love-of-hand-me-downs-sponsored.html" target="_blank"&gt;included&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;this&amp;nbsp;plaid romper in my last post (as in, BUY THIS PLEASE!) and then I went and bought it myself even though it was in the boy's section and I told myself I wouldn't buy anything else.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/8676303620/" title="IMG_2131_1024x1024 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_2131_1024x1024" height="640" src="http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8519/8676303620_57d78c754b_z.jpg" width="428" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;And miraculously? Revi will wear it, too. Even though Bo wore it first...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10140888306/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2814/10140888306_db33157306_z.jpg" width="488" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Revi will rock that gingham jumper all day long. In the park and in the dark and here and there and everywhere. It's a Christmas miracle, really.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10074272703/" title="photo-11 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-11" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7416/10074272703_1bbca2d28b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Meanwhile, I have decided to sell some of our gently worn clothes on Moxie Jean, some of which are currently available to purchase right this minute. (With more coming soon! I'll try to update here asap when new pieces show on the site!)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The proceeds of my share of the sales will be donated to families in need via the &lt;a href="https://www.luriechildrens.org/en-us/Pages/index.aspx" target="_blank"&gt;Ann &amp;amp; Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago&lt;/a&gt;. (&lt;a href="http://www.moxiejean.com/pages/sell-baby-clothes" target="_blank"&gt;When you sell clothes to Moxie Jean you can either get cash/credit/or donate your earnings&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;to help children/families through the hospital.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Here are a few of our (sniff! sob!) old beloved threads:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.moxiejean.com/products/218660" target="_blank"&gt;Misha Lulu skirt&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;12-18 months:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10142355423/" title="misha skirt by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="misha skirt" height="500" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7352/10142355423_b3f73ab80a.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.moxiejean.com/products/218832" target="_blank"&gt;Janie &amp;amp; Jack blouse,&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;2T:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10142319836/" title="purple blouse by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="purple blouse" height="500" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3665/10142319836_e4168f9d72.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.moxiejean.com/products/218831" target="_blank"&gt;REI Vest&lt;/a&gt;:&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10142264425/" title="Untitled by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Untitled" height="499" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7314/10142264425_7a924033e3.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;(Archer took his first steps in this. target="_blank"&gt;this for a tiny gentleman&lt;/a&gt;. (Or lady.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10144724283/" title="IMG_2147_grande by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_2147_grande" height="600" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7410/10144724283_59bf6254ff_z.jpg" width="400" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;(This one is my favorite. I wish it was in Revi's size.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;For more vintage &amp;amp; resale cuteness, go &lt;a href="http://www.moxiejean.com/" target="_blank"&gt;here&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;and to sell/donate clothes, &lt;a href="http://www.moxiejean.com/pages/sell-baby-clothes" target="_blank"&gt;go here.&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;(Moxie Jean just launched a new mobile friendly site so you can access via phone as well.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10140936673/" title="photo-8 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-8" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5330/10140936673_0b9ac345df.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10140946783/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7439/10140946783_2a617f613c.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Be sure to use code GGCMOXIE to get 30% off all outerwear + vests + sweaters. Free shipping on all orders over $50. Happy shopping, all!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Signed,&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;i style="text-align: center;"&gt;Rompers are my Weakness*&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10140896826/" title="photo-9 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-9" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7424/10140896826_00db1667a5_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;*&lt;b&gt;RAMW&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;!--3--&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml'
