CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-2293828162022228265</id><published>2013-10-07T09:33:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-07T09:33:04.997-07:00</updated><title type='text'>Story Time: Bats at The Beach </title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10073836944/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3701/10073836944_2c04e25a15.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;This week's book rec is one of my all-time favorites, a gift Fable received for her 4th birthday and one that has quickly become one of our nightly go-tos. It's called &lt;a href="http://www.amazon.com/Bats-at-Beach-Brian-Lies/dp/B004TE7JOI" target="_blank"&gt;Bats at the Beach, it was written and illustrated by: Bryn Lies&lt;/a&gt; and it's full of whimsy, wisdom and warmth.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10073946783/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7349/10073946783_655b7991cb.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10073950213/" title="photo-10 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-10" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5327/10073950213_a6fbaa3a22.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Bats at The Beach is beautifully done across the board. Especially for kids who might be afraid of the dark...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10073956843/" title="photo-8 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-8" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7293/10073956843_4865ff64af.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10073969603/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="386" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7331/10073969603_c6307e7e17.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;...it provides this really warm, playful place for children to go in their dreams, where moon tanning is a thing and bats fly each other like kites -- &amp;nbsp;the perfect "last story" read before lights out.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10073831384/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7377/10073831384_1f7a2b9122.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10073899086/" title="photo-7 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-7" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5541/10073899086_45b4b23365.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;For more on Bats at the Beach including activities c/o the author, go &lt;a href="http://www.brianlies.com/brian_lies_beach_main.html" target="_blank"&gt;here&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10073869015/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5452/10073869015_9ee29959a0_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;Happy day, all.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10073902556/" title="photo-6 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-6" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3819/10073902556_4f3bc46d8d_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/2293828162022228265/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=2293828162022228265' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/2293828162022228265'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/2293828162022228265'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/story-time-bats-at-beach.html' title='Story Time: Bats at The Beach '/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-1874636302424433017</id><published>2013-10-03T20:49:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-03T20:49:18.974-07:00</updated><title type='text'>A Very Cool Thing: Rainbow in My Room</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10072450804/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3725/10072450804_da6971595a.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;When I ordered Fable a "&lt;a href="http://www.amazon.com/Uncle-Milton-Rainbow-In-Room/dp/B000TK8440" target="_blank"&gt;Rainbow in my Room&lt;/a&gt;" I didn't think it would &lt;i&gt;actually &lt;/i&gt;produce rainbows. I had hoped, sure, but too many times I've been excited about ordering things for the kids only to have them arrive broken or weird or completely contrary to the way they were advertised. But last night, when Fable unwrapped her rainbow maker machine and we set it up, turned it on, I cried.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;To be fair, I cried when she unwrapped all of her presents because children are so gracious with their facial expressions and also I cry pretty much all the time. I blame my mother who is the same way and my grandfather who is also the same way. It's hereditary for sure.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10072485275/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3789/10072485275_0593c08cdd.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10072522376/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3666/10072522376_e8d8ef194a.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Fable and I gasped out loud when the rainbow appeared across the wall and then proceeded to roll around beneath it while singing, somewhhhhhhheeeeeere undeeeerrrr the raiiiiinbow.... skies are... black because it's super late and past your bedtime you're going to sleep after thissssss...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;ED: On the various websites it says to place the rainbow maker on a "bed stand" but for those with kids in bunk beds, we found it works 10000 times better to stick the light in the bunk somewhere. Like, say, a pillow?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10072577683/" title="photo-9 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-9" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7289/10072577683_82c9bdd391.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Amazing, right? I mean, THESE THINGS EXIST. &lt;i&gt;Science, you animal! &lt;a href="http://unclemilton.com/in_my_room/rainbow_in_my_room/" target="_blank"&gt;Uncle Milton, you magic maker!&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;So there you have it. Yesterday Fable had an amazing birthday. She went to school, wore a huge cardboard birthday necklace, went to "kinder rock" class, danced to Katy Perry's ROAR, &lt;a href="http://instagram.com/p/fA72cNrAR6/" target="_blank"&gt;gave Rainbowflower a fierce makeover&lt;/a&gt;, ate a cupcake, read books and fell asleep under a rainbow.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10072520666/" title="photo-7 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-7" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3818/10072520666_1d38bcd2cb.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;(Best $22 ever spent.)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/1874636302424433017/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=1874636302424433017' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1874636302424433017'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1874636302424433017'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/10/a-very-cool-thing-rainbow-in-my-room.html' title='A Very Cool Thing: Rainbow in My Room'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-123158520642690361</id><published>2013-10-02T13:22:00.001-07:00</published><updated>2013-10-02T14:50:27.979-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='life story'/><title type='text'>Bright On: Five Years of Fable</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10056220573/" title="IMG_8026 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_8026" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2839/10056220573_ae465b8f2d_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10056145156/" title="IMG_8246 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_8246" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7430/10056145156_be2fc79751_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;When I was five years old I dressed up as Rainbow Brite. It was the first and last time I wore a "pretty" costume for Halloween - a lifetime of showing up at parties dressed as a werewolf, an old man, a young man, a chicken with rubber gloves for feet, a boy, a man, "Kevin" the rat, Hal... &amp;nbsp;I have always been uncomfortable in feminine costumes for whatever reason but that year? THAT YEAR I was Rainbow Brite. And I felt it.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;One of my earliest memories is pulling those boots up over my shins and feeling... &lt;i&gt;bright. &amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;There was something about her. She was beautiful, sure, but she was also fiercely independent. She was confident and spirited and unabashed.&amp;nbsp;She wore rainbows on her face and in her hair and on her shoes. &lt;i&gt;She was a loner, Dottie. A rebel&lt;/i&gt;. With a unicorn. She was magic. And I was... not. Not in real life, anyway.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I spent the early part of my childhood unable to speak publicly. To my teachers. And peers. I used to pray to whatever god was out there, for words to come out of my mouth so that I could say the answers out loud. It took three years for me to garner the strength to raise my hand in class. I was paralyzed with fear that if I opened my mouth to speak, everyone would hear my thoughts. And that they would hate them and me by default, so I bottled everything up and filed them away.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br class="Apple-interchange-newline" /&gt;It's so hard to separate our own experiences as children. So much of the emotional complexity of parenthood stems from our own retrospection. It is impossible for us to know what our children are going through at any given time. And yet, we assume, because we have been children before, that we have been there in the same way. Because&lt;i&gt; we are cut from the same cloth&lt;/i&gt;. Because&lt;i&gt; apples don't fall far from trees&lt;/i&gt;. Because &lt;i&gt;like mother like daughter&lt;/i&gt;. So we project. Mainly&amp;nbsp;because it comes with the job description to be projectors. Of our experiences and our lessons, our philosophies and truths.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Sometimes, when I pick my kids up at school, I feel myself regress into the little girl hiding under the slide, the third grader unable to raise her hand, speak up, say SOMETHING. &lt;i&gt;Anything. Please just open your mouth and say hello. &lt;/i&gt;I flatten myself against walls. Wait in the back. Sit on the floor.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Fable is the other side of that coin. She is a powerhouse. A hand-raiser. A sing-at-the-top of her lungs-er. A stand-up-for-herself-er. A leader in the classic sense. The opposite of invisible. The antithesis of afraid. Standing tall with flags in her hands, she is the very opposite of me.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;She speaks with voice I spent years trying to pull from my gut and have spent my whole life trying to capture with my fingers. Without apologizing. Or feeling ashamed.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;She is Fable and she roars. With opinions. And ideas. &amp;nbsp;And joy. And more artwork than I know what to do with.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9780930221/" title="photo-10 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-10" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3705/9780930221_f7baed53d4_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10042280404/" title="IMG_9671 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9671" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3782/10042280404_10b432b246_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9682082683/" title="IMG_5261 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_5261" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5498/9682082683_cbe852b3c8_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;It's the first day of Summer Camp and we're waiting in line to check in. Fable spent half the morning artfully decorating her head with hair-clips. A rainbow on one side and a collage of bows and sparkly bobby pins on the other. Twenty of them, maybe? Thirty? She insisted on wearing them on this morning, in honor of camp. Archer and I waited outside the bathroom until she was done.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;A couple of older girls stand in front of us and do a double-take when they see Fable step outside the line. She spins and sings a song to herself. Does a little hand-on-hip action, gets back in line.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"Look at that little girl's hair," one girl giggles, pointing. She's twice Fable's size and one of the oldest girls at camp.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"Is she being serious.&amp;nbsp;&lt;i&gt;Nice look.&lt;/i&gt;"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Fable says nothing. She looks back at me and I smile, offer her my hand for a high-five, hoping she didn't hear them.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;But she did. &lt;i&gt;Of course she did.&lt;/i&gt;&amp;nbsp; I see it on her face. A... hesitation.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10056175086/" title="IMG_7317 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_7317" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7350/10056175086_ddafea867a_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;I'm a mess on the drive home, like I just sent my kid into the lion's den. Like this is the beginning of the end of a moment in time where she felt free to be Fable. I am heartbroken. Crushed. I can barely see over the steering wheel I'm so small.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I picture her all alone, hair clips in her back pocket, wandering around the campus looking for spiders to name.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;Because that would have been me.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I picture her hiding in the bathroom with her feet pulled up in the stall so nobody could see her feet.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;Because that would have been me.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And then something happens. I return to camp at the end of the day and can't find Fable anywhere. I ask Archer if he's seen her lately and he hasn't. He hasn't seen her all day, he says. We look in all of the classrooms and finally spot her through the open door of the auditorium, hand in hand with the same girls who were laughing at her earlier, hair clips still in tact, every single one.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;They're dancing. Together. All of them.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I am stunned.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I shouldn't be. She's my kid and I know her by heart. And yet...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;Because that wouldn't have been me, &lt;/i&gt;I feel jolted.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And relieved. And grateful. And idiotic. And amazed. And and and and...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"How was your day?"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"It was just amazing," she says, talking with her hands. "I drew so many princesses. "&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10042308494/" title="IMG_9329 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9329" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7403/10042308494_5ab1ba66a4_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9970614055/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5508/9970614055_c80ab8da34_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Fable used to tell me that in the years before she was born, she spent a lot of her time hanging out inside my leg. It is one of my favorite things I have ever heard and I regularly picture her balled up behind my knee, moving me forward. I imagine her there, in my calf, helping me navigate elementary school and then junior high and beyond... I imagine her there when I found out I was pregnant with her brother. When I married her dad. And until this day, five years ago, when she broke free and into my arms.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I imagine trace amounts of her there, still. In my legs and my gut and my head. &lt;i&gt;What would Fable do, I&lt;/i&gt; think, in many instances&lt;i&gt;. How would she handle this.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I was so afraid of mothering daughters. I used to write about it all the time when I was pregnant with her and then in those months after she was born. I struggled with my own femininity for years. I still do in a way. But with Fable came a great love and respect for myself that was never there before. I looked into the eyes of my daughter and fell in love with womankind. She was my connection to the women before me and the women after her and the dominos fell one by one from there.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I took my hands out of my pockets and &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2012/03/on-finally-accepting-feminism.html" target="_blank"&gt;joined hands with my fellow sisters&lt;/a&gt;. Daughters once. Daughters always. Just like mine.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9970706173/" title="photo-25 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-25" height="502" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5346/9970706173_67e9275c1c_z.jpg" width="504" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10059531085/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="499" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3826/10059531085_37fc32a617.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Fable was honored yesterday at the Student of the Month assembly. Her first month at a big kid school and there she was, beaming on stage, holding her sticker and her certificate, like, "can you believe this?"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And &lt;i&gt;of course I can&lt;/i&gt;. Of course I could. But also, wow.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;When Fable's teacher described why she chose her, it was this: "She's such a bright kid."&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;And I thought, YES. That is it! That is exactly what she is. She is brightness personified. Intelligent and interesting, wise and whimsical. Confident and mighty and colorful and creative and BRIGHT.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10042331245/" title="IMG_3463_2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_3463_2" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2817/10042331245_8681fc769b_z.jpg" width="474" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;This year she's going as a rainbow for Halloween. She is the dream I had for myself when I was her age. But more importantly she is the dream &lt;i&gt;she has &lt;/i&gt;for herself in this moment. The strong, self-aware, fiercely independent rainbow&amp;nbsp;&lt;i&gt;bright.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: start;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10040877754/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3747/10040877754_674fb64626_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10040887444/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7436/10040887444_6f2ca2f563_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Fable was born with an innate ability to draw hearts around everyone, to be visible and open and generous with her light. To make friends with everyone she meets.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Instead of compromising who she was that first day of camp, instead of suppressing and bottling and hiding all of the things that make her different and unique and amazing, she wore those clips with pride. She wears ALL OF IT with pride. And joy. And brightness.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;...Even when the older girls laugh.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Or tell her her socks don't match...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;...&lt;i&gt; that rainbow isn't a color.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;Even when she feels the sting of hesitation&lt;i&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;Instead of acquiescing to her critics, she dances with them. She takes their hands in hers and she dances.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9970561845/" title="photo-31 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-31" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7355/9970561845_f489b43208_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10042363665/" title="IMG_3143 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_3143" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7368/10042363665_89e404d338_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10057791836/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7451/10057791836_213e641f46_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10040943426/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3746/10040943426_050c7cbac8_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9685310090/" title="IMG_5432 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_5432" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5495/9685310090_aca111db51_z.jpg" width="479" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10057725914/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7328/10057725914_470a24bdc0_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10057788406/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7330/10057788406_8048d263fa_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10058022666/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3780/10058022666_8074f96c16_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10058018706/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7453/10058018706_9aa837057e_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10057778526/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5506/10057778526_f059e7fd38_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='text'>Back at The Hungtington: Photos </title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10023477616/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="500" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5342/10023477616_ed5285b5f3.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/08/places-to-see-huntington.html" target="_blank"&gt;I wrote about The Huntington a few weeks&lt;/a&gt; back but over the weekend we went again, this time with the whole crew. We visited the Children's Garden and came home covered in grass rash and mud because of all the rolling and somersaulting and turtle pond-ing but it was completely worth it.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Some photos from our day in The Children's Garden and beyond....&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10023328543/" on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5321/10024177475_72b3418b88_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-1493527646028110420</id><published>2013-09-30T11:08:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-09-30T13:39:44.934-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='mix tape'/><title type='text'>181/100</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10022490834/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7414/10022490834_8149f1cb3b.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;I had no idea I was a huge Jack Johnson fan until I got into the car Friday afternoon and this song was playing and OH, HEY, NAILER OF LYRICS, SINGER SONGWRITER OF MY DREAMS.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;If you add us up&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;then subtract my lack of sleep.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;I didn't sleep much last week for reasons that have no rhyme. And I'm a little embarrassed by my flare for the dramatic. It sucks being a human being sometimes. And there are plenty of times when I wake up and I'm like "NOOOO! Why did you write that thing?"&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10022626743/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5454/10022626743_361bf8eb4a.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;i&gt;I've been erasing.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;Rewrote the second half like this&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;So my protagonist&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;might find his way back home.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Anyway, this week I promise not to take myself so seriously. But first, because it's Monday, a song.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/krzK0Is6K5w?rel=0" width="420"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Found my foundation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;It was underneath me all along&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Sing it, Jack Johnson. Fist to the chest. Feet on the floor.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10022799073/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3728/10022799073_b5bf528745_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;181. As I was Saying by: &lt;a href="http://jackjohnsonmusic.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Jack Johnson&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/10023144336/" title="IMG_8395 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_8395" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7395/10023144336_968d71d850_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;TGIN&lt;span style="font-size: xx-small;"&gt;ew&lt;/span&gt;W&lt;span style="font-size: xx-small;"&gt;eek&lt;/span&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/1493527646028110420/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=1493527646028110420' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1493527646028110420'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1493527646028110420'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/09/181100.html' title='181/100'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-8688821635016179704</id><published>2013-09-27T15:47:00.002-07:00</published><updated>2013-09-27T15:47:34.542-07:00</updated><title type='text'>light work</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9970631424/" title="photo-7 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-7" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3757/9970631424_5d1b6de1d4.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;When I was little my mom used to tell us, "many hands make light work," which, of course, meant, many hands make LESS work. As in, if we all pitch in, there will be less to do. I did not know that is what she meant until she said it to my kids a few years ago and I realized that she meant "less" and not ACTUAL light. I assumed "many hands make light work" was in reference to light itself. As in illumination. As in, if we come together we can make everything glow.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I was embarrassed by my misunderstanding at first. Like that time I thought "quitting cold turkey" was actually &lt;i&gt;cold turkey as a thing people eat to help quit smoking.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br class="Apple-interchange-newline" /&gt;But then I realized that LIGHT and light are the same thing. That many hands make less work but also LIGHT work. That by coming together, everything is illuminated. All that perspective, man. It helps.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I struggle with this in a major way. I want to do it all on my own or do nothing at all. When I feel overwhelmed, I close the door instead of picking up the phone. I fake it. Or write about it here in vague terms. (Kind of like I did this week). But I also picked up the phone. I called in favors. I asked for help. Which probably doesn't sound like much but it was for me. And then I felt amazing because everyone was so kind. And helpful. And oh so THIS is how this works. Like that game Light as a Feather, Stiff as a Board and how it feels like magic because how is it possible for fingers to lift someone wayyyy up high? Well? It is. Many hands can do that.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9970760674/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5500/9970760674_3697e36c94_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9971598623/" title="photo-5 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-5" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5520/9971598623_4c76f3bf1a_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9970614266/" title="photo-14 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-14" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7337/9970614266_7f14bd51e0_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9970617524/" title="photo-15 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-15" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3723/9970617524_ac58fc887f_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9970748233/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7311/9970748233_cf77beaf40_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left;"&gt;(light on.)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9971595243/" style="text-align: center;" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5329/9971595243_389dc4152d_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9970629814/" title="photo-8 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-8" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5513/9970629814_879051b8cb_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/8688821635016179704/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=8688821635016179704' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/8688821635016179704'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/8688821635016179704'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/09/light-work.html' title='light work'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-833969947762633215</id><published>2013-09-26T10:02:00.001-07:00</published><updated>2013-09-26T10:10:28.856-07:00</updated><title type='text'>Stories We Tell</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9946122574/" title="SWT-poster by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="SWT-poster" height="800" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2830/9946122574_802fd9467a_c.jpg" width="554" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I've been spending a lot of time inside my head lately. Maybe you've noticed. Maybe you haven't. Sometimes I feel removed from my life in a way I can't really explain and sometimes I feel like everyone lives in my head with me in the computer. Not everyone, obviously, but people. Some people.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I feel affected lately in ways I don't usually feel. So books and films and music have been medicinal in a way. I'm looking for answers in places where I don't belong.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;So when Hal and sat down to watch&lt;i&gt; &lt;a href="http://www.storieswetellmovie.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Stories We Tell&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;, with very little knowledge of what we were getting into, it was like standing on top of the answers without knowing it.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;It was like opening a door to a place that had always existed but was suddenly revealed.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Ten years ago I wrote a novel called The Envelope. It was the last of three unpublished novels I wrote before I got pregnant with Archer, and in the beginning of the manuscript is this:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="line-height: 200%;"&gt;“L&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="line-height: 200%;"&gt;ies can only be embedded in truth. They have no separate existence… A good lie reveals more than truth can ever reveal. To the one, that is, that seeks truth.”&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;!--[if gte mso 9]&gt;&lt;xml&gt; &lt;o:DocumentProperties&gt;  &lt;o:Revision&gt;0&lt;/o:Revision&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 2 Accent 3"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="69" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 3 Accent 3"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="66" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 2 Accent 4"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="67" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 1 Accent 4"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 2 Accent 4"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="69" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 3 Accent 4"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="70" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Dark List Accent 4"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="71" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Shading Accent 4"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="72" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful List Accent 4"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="73" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Grid Accent 4"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="60" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Shading Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="61" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light List Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="62" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Grid Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="63" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 1 Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="64" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 2 Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="65" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 1 Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="66" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 2 Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="67" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 1 Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 2 Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="69" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 3 Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="70" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Dark List Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="71" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Shading Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="72" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful List Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="73" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Grid Accent 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="60" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Shading Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="61" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light List Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="62" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Grid Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="63" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 1 Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="64" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 2 Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="65" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 1 Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="66" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 2 Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="67" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 1 Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 2 Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="69" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 3 Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="70" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Dark List Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="71" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Shading Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="72" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful List Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="73" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Grid Accent 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="19" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Subtle Emphasis"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="21" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Intense Emphasis"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="31" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Subtle Reference"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="32" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Intense Reference"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="33" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Book Title"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="37" Name="Bibliography"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" QFormat="true" Name="TOC Heading"/&gt; &lt;/w:LatentStyles&gt;&lt;/xml&gt;&lt;![endif]--&gt; &lt;!--[if gte mso 10]&gt;&lt;style&gt; /* Style Definitions */ table.MsoNormalTable  {mso-style-name:"Table Normal";  mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;  mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;  mso-style-noshow:yes;  mso-style-priority:99;  mso-style-parent:"";  mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;  mso-para-margin:0in;  mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;  mso-pagination:widow-orphan;  font-size:10.0pt;  font-family:"Times New Roman";} &lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]--&gt;   &lt;!--StartFragment--&gt;         &lt;!--EndFragment--&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: 200%;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;—Henry Miller, Sexus&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br class="Apple-interchange-newline" /&gt;The book was an homage to the truthful part of lies.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I wanted so badly to be a novelist but I wasn't there yet. I'm still not. Someday. But I believe that truth is complex and nuanced and far from factual. That the reason we love books and films and fantasies, the reason we want to write them and make them and dream them is that they act as guides for us, the writers and the readers. They help us find our way to the answers. Or better yet, remind us that there are none.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;There would be no story then.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;These words found themselves into my fingers the night Hal and I watched Stories We Tell so I wrote them down. And now I'm writing them down again, here, with the hope that they may trigger something in you.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Or maybe I just need a place to put them.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I don't want to publish any more books. Not now, anyway.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;But I do want to keep writing.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Here, for now, but not forever. That was made very clear to me this week. There is an expiration date here. Which is a scary thought but also an exciting one. It's why I'm pushing myself in different directions behind the scenes, trying to reorganize my time to write about things outside my story so that I can realize some of the truth I seem to have misplaced.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Because if I don't...&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;There would be no story then.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;In the beginning of&lt;b&gt;&amp;nbsp;Stories We Tell,&lt;/b&gt;&amp;nbsp; Sarah Polley's father reads a quote by Margaret Atwood. It says:&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;h1 class="quoteText" style="background-color: white; color: #181818; font-family: georgia, serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; padding: 0px; text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;“When you are in the middle of a story it isn't a story at all, but only a confusion; a dark roaring, a blindness... &amp;nbsp;It's only afterwards that it becomes anything like a story at all. When you are telling it, to yourself or to someone else.”&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/h1&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;This is why we write. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Like cleaning up a mess.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;This is why we push on.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And reflect.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;And come to terms with our ridiculousness.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;By telling stories.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Out loud or on paper, in songs and on screens.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br class="Apple-interchange-newline" /&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/ytq4VZ2Nyxg?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div&gt;This is supposed to be a post about&lt;b&gt;&amp;nbsp;Stories We Tell&lt;/b&gt;&amp;nbsp;and I have made it into&amp;nbsp;&lt;b&gt;Story I Am Telling&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;because for better and for worse, that is what I do here. Because this film affected me deeply and made me want to share things I might otherwise have kept to myself. It made me feel grateful for the storytellers.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Whether we recognize it or not, we live for the stories. We wake up for the stories. We point our children in the direction of the stories.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"Bring back the moral," we say.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"Find the meaning and put in your heart."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZrhVKwDJIGg" target="_blank"&gt;These are the fables.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;We sit down every day with the hope that we can find them within ourselves and outside ourselves and somehow smash them together to make something that matters.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9946212263/" title="a34 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="a34" height="281" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3779/9946212263_a750410ea9.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;That's what connects us. &amp;nbsp;An honest story will always be a universal one, beloved, despised, universal.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;If she hadn't..?&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;If he didn't..?&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;If she wasn't...?&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;If they weren't...?&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;There would be no story then.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9946122124/" title="Stories_we_tell_Trailer_HD_A_film_by_Sarah_Polley.mp4_snapshot_01.26_2012.11.07_20.51.03 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Stories_we_tell_Trailer_HD_A_film_by_Sarah_Polley.mp4_snapshot_01.26_2012.11.07_20.51.03" height="281" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7428/9946122124_76c9ceae34.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;Thank you, Sarah Polley for sharing &lt;a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2366450/" target="_blank"&gt;yours.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' width='72'/><thr:total>2</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-5712494923749496933</id><published>2013-09-24T20:10:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-09-24T23:50:22.196-07:00</updated><title type='text'>Liner Notes 9/24</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9911115863/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3809/9911115863_608862b0c0.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9910299545/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7436/9910299545_33791e2d87.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9910304055/" title="IMG_6752 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_6752" height="358" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3781/9910304055_e03cc840d7.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9910476363/" title="IMG_6709 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_6709" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5469/9910476363_6e75835098.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: inherit;"&gt;My little brother's getting married. I don't know why I just typed "little" because he's about to be thirty and he's a legit adult and, like, ten feet taller than I am, but when I think of him, I think of him being this little kid.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;And everyone in the neighborhood is wearing rainbow suspenders.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;And every car on the road is a Datsun.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;       &lt;!--[if gte mso 9]&gt;&lt;xml&gt; &lt;o:DocumentProperties&gt;  &lt;o:Revision&gt;0&lt;/o:Revision&gt;  &lt;o:TotalTime&gt;0&lt;/o:TotalTime&gt;  &lt;o:Pages&gt;1&lt;/o:Pages&gt;  &lt;o:Words&gt;76&lt;/o:Words&gt; &lt;w:LatentStyles DefLockedState="false" DefUnhideWhenUsed="true"   DefSemiHidden="true" DefQFormat="false" DefPriority="99"   LatentStyleCount="276"&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="0" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Normal"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="9" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="heading 1"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="9" QFormat="true" Name="heading 2"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="9" QFormat="true" Name="heading 3"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="9" QFormat="true" Name="heading 4"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="9" QFormat="true" Name="heading 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="9" QFormat="true" Name="heading 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="9" QFormat="true" Name="heading 7"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="9" QFormat="true" Name="heading 8"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="9" QFormat="true" Name="heading 9"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" Name="toc 1"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" Name="toc 2"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" Name="toc 3"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" Name="toc 4"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" Name="toc 5"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" Name="toc 6"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" Name="toc 7"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" Name="toc 8"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="39" Name="toc 9"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="35" QFormat="true" Name="caption"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="10" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Title"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="1" Name="Default Paragraph Font"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="11" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Subtitle"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="22" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Strong"/&gt;  &lt;w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="20" SemiHidden="false"    UnhideWhenUsed="false" QFormat="true" Name="Emphasis"/&gt;
