src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-1439383707008766109</id><published>2013-08-08T15:41:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-08-21T11:21:08.355-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='she section'/><title type='text'>"Be a Man"</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="background-color: white; margin-bottom: 6px; text-align: center; word-wrap: break-word;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #353a3d;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit; line-height: 19px;"&gt;This is an extremely important watch. Thanks for &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/07/boy-culture-on-masks-and-eye-patches.html#comment-983750808" target="_blank"&gt;the share, Kirsten&lt;/a&gt;.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #353a3d;"&gt;&lt;span style="line-height: 19px;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #353a3d;"&gt;&lt;span style="line-height: 19px;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/jVI1Xutc_Ws?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="background-color: white; color: #353a3d; line-height: 1.4; margin-bottom: 6px; word-wrap: break-word;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;"All of life is about relationships. It's about the capacity to love and be loved. What does it mean to be a man? It means you can look someone in the eye and say I love you and receive that love back... &lt;span style="line-height: 1.4;"&gt;What would happen if (we) all came together and said this next generation of boys, 'we're going to teach that them that the essence, the epitome of what it means to be a man emanates from the heart?'... "&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="line-height: 1.4;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="line-height: 1.4;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;- &lt;a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Ehrmann" target="_blank"&gt;Joe Ehrmann&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;***&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;For more about Joe Ehrmann and his fight for manKINDNESS go &lt;a href="http://www.coachforamerica.com/meet-joe" target="_blank"&gt;here.&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;GGC&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/1439383707008766109/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=1439383707008766109' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1439383707008766109'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1439383707008766109'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/08/be-man.html' title='&quot;Be a Man&quot;'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-8969741411391373460</id><published>2013-08-07T10:15:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-08-07T10:15:50.867-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='eat well'/><title type='text'>Eat Well: Galettes on the Go</title><content type='html'>&lt;div class="MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;The following post was written by my mom, WWW. Thanks, mom!&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9442513094/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7339/9442513094_48043f456f.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;In &lt;a href="http://www.alexandracooks.com/2009/09/21/tomato-corn-cheese-galette-%E2%80%94-a-favorite-summer-meal-%E2%80%94-with-a-chocolate-chip-cookie-for-dessert/" target="_blank"&gt;my last post on tomatoes&lt;/a&gt;, a reader commented that she uses her home-grown tomatoes to make galettes. (Thank you, Joanne!) &amp;nbsp;What is really weird is that the night before she commented, I had been reading one of my cookbooks, had come across a galette recipe and had book-marked it to try.&amp;nbsp; I used to make tarts all of the time but have gotten out of the habit, and the idea that you can make a tart without worrying about a pan or pre-baking it with beans to hold the dough down really appealed to me.&amp;nbsp; So, when I saw the comment by Joanne on my post, I realized it was a sign for me to learn all there is to know about galettes. &lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal"&gt;In France, a galette is often street food—a buckwheat crepe filled with a savory or sweet filling, served from the window of a creperie.&amp;nbsp; It is the French version of&amp;nbsp; ‘fast food’ and there is nothing more delicious. But a galette can also be a rustic free-form tart.&amp;nbsp; Instead of baked in a traditional tart pan, the dough is rolled out thinly, layered with a sweet or savory filling leaving a couple of inches around the perimeter of the dough.&amp;nbsp; The dough is then folded over and the whole thing is baked.&amp;nbsp; There are endless recipes for galette dough and fillings, but you can really have fun experimenting with ingredients and come up with your own favorites, much like putting together toppings for pizza.&amp;nbsp; I can’t think of a better or more forgiving food type for creative culinary expression.&amp;nbsp; And making galettes is a great way to use up leftovers or vegetable odds and ends. &lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal"&gt;I used David Lebovitz’ savory galette dough recipe that Joanne linked to but I made my own filling with ingredients I had in the house since we are going out of town on Thursday and I am trying to use up what we have in the refrigerator.&amp;nbsp; Rebecca and her kids were down for a few days, so Fable and Archer were on hand to roll out the dough and arrange the filling. The results were so delicious that we made it two nights in a row. (YES!!&amp;nbsp; More ways to use my abundance of tomatoes!!) And now I can’t wait to experiment with different fillings, both savory and sweet.&amp;nbsp; I substituted gluten-free flour mix (Pamela’s Artisan flour) for the flour and it worked great.&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Tomato Cheese Galette&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;b&gt;For the dough:&lt;/b&gt; (&lt;a href="http://www.finecooking.com/recipes/cornmeal_galette_dough.aspx" target="_blank"&gt;DavidLebovitz’ savory cornmeal galette dough&lt;/a&gt;.)&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 6.0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;5 oz. (1-1/4 cups) all-purpose flour (or gluten free flour)&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 6.0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;1-1/2 oz. (1/3 cup) fine yellow cornmeal&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 6.0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;1 tsp. sugar&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 6.0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;1-1/4 tsp. salt (I used scant 1 tsp.)&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 6.0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;3 oz. (6 Tbs.) unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces and chilled&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 6.0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;3 Tbs. olive oil&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 6.0pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;2 oz. (1/4 cup) ice water&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold; mso-fareast-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;In a medium bowl, mix together the flour, cornmeal, sugar, and salt. Cut in the chilled butter using a stand mixer, a food processor, or a pastry blender until it's evenly distributed but still in large, visible pieces.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9410822107/" title="IMG_0080 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0080" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3802/9410822107_8dd44e29c6.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;Add the olive oil and ice water and mix until the dough begins to come together. Gather the dough with your hands and shape it into a disk. Wrap the disk in plastic and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9410819011/" title="IMG_0082 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0082" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5346/9410819011_97c2b20c38.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;For the filling:&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;2-3 heirloom tomatoes&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;1 cup ricotta cheese&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;4 oz mozzarella cheese, shredded&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;4 garlic cloves, finely minced&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;3 T chopped fresh basil&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;½ teaspoon red pepper flakes&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;more whole basil leaves&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;3 T freshly grated Parmesan cheese&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;Preheat oven to 375. Slice tomatoes and lay slices on two layers of paper towels to drain.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9410816703/" title="IMG_0088 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0088" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3762/9410816703_d6bff5ce5f.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Roll dough to a 10-inch circle on parchment paper (flour the rolling pin so dough doesn’t stick).&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9410812787/" title="IMG_0092 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0092" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5517/9410812787_d8300349aa.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Mix together cheeses, garlic, chopped basil, and pepper flakes.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9410817925/" title="IMG_0085 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0085" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3808/9410817925_ba159f675d.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Spread the mixture on the dough, leaving about a 2 ½ inch border.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9413573552/" title="IMG_0095 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0095" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5537/9413573552_fdfcb56b45.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Place drained tomato slices on top of cheese mixture. (You can overlap them them if you want—Fable preferred them separated, but the second night I layered them and both ways were delicious.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9413569054/" title="IMG_0099 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0099" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5482/9413569054_f700057703.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9410807423/" title="IMG_0098 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0098" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7339/9410807423_6d121ef83e.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9413561578/" title="IMG_0106 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0106" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7428/9413561578_397ebb1835.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Sprinkle tomatoes with Parmesan cheese.&amp;nbsp; Fold edges over the dough, pleating as you fold.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9442514734/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7410/9442514734_c3073cc02e.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;(Don’t worry if it looks kind of messy….It doesn’t matter!) Place parchment paper on a cookie sheet (without sides). Bake on middle rack in your oven for 40-50 minutes, or until crust is golden brown. Sprinkle hot galette with fresh whole basil leaves.&amp;nbsp; Let cool slightly and drizzle with a little olive oil.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9442513094/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7339/9442513094_48043f456f.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;Serve.&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9442511240/" title="photo-4 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-4" height="374" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2845/9442511240_9cd003c4a4.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal" style="background: white; margin-bottom: 12.75pt;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;(Make a face, close your eyes and eat?)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;…..&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;Love,&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #363636; mso-bidi-font-family: &amp;quot;Times New Roman&amp;quot;; mso-fareast-language: EN-US;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;WWW&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;o:p&gt;&lt;/o:p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class="MsoNormal"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/8969741411391373460/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='mix tape'/><title type='text'>174/100</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9450430882/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7281/9450430882_33f5d1df65_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;This week marks Archer and Fable's last week of summer so I'm taking the week off (ish) and spending it with them doing adventure-y type day trips around town. Nothing in the woods, unfortunately, but this song/video still seemed somewhat apropos: (Thanks to &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/05/166100.html" target="_blank"&gt;Bree for the tip a couple months back&lt;/a&gt;. I'm now a huge Paper Kites fan.)&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/M0IDiVQxZYg?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;174. Featherstone by: &lt;a href="http://www.thepaperkites.com.au/" target="_blank"&gt;The Paper Kites&lt;/a&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9450426498/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="500" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3757/9450426498_8b48992a44.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9447644581/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="500" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3667/9447644581_c5021e7dea.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;P.S. The awesome Rebe has kindly created a mix on &lt;a href="http://www.spotify.com/" target="_blank"&gt;spotify&lt;/a&gt; of most of my Mix Tape posts. It's called "GGC Mixtape" for those on Spotify who are interested. Thanks, Rebe!&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/5891613272492825061/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=5891613272492825061' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' title='174/100'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-1322070402948002278</id><published>2013-08-05T08:03:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-08-05T08:03:26.841-07:00</updated><title type='text'>The Month in Moments: July </title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435772395/" title="photo-29 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-29" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3810/9435772395_e050f52bd7_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9424654991/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2818/9424654991_10e5a6413f_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9427425102/" title="photo (2) by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo (2)" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3690/9427425102_14d6e8db08_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435847539/" title="IMG_0869 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0869" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3805/9435847539_df7e7d6b71_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435803193/" title="photo-13 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-13" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3816/9435803193_5247852e69_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9438586560/" title="photo-12 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-12" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3685/9438586560_eba4724e2d_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435788273/" title="photo-22 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-22" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3704/9435788273_aa02e6e01b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9303401350/" title="IMG_0333 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0333" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2865/9303401350_0f6d2c596b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9438551952/" title="photo-30 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-30" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2871/9438551952_96bc3ebde4_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435782539/" title="photo-24 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-24" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5448/9435782539_5c9b0ede1b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435778389/" title="photo-26 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-26" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7413/9435778389_d45a0762e0_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9438613836/" title="IMG_1013 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_1013" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5458/9438613836_3c0d75be6b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435775713/" title="photo-27 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-27" height="640" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2871/9435775713_c577468eb8_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435797567/" title="photo-17 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-17" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7285/9435797567_abcd8e0fb6_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9296612664/" title="IMG_0635 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0635" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5451/9296612664_eb2dee035d_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2826/9272454264_9dca480ab7_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9438608574/" title="photo-2 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-2" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5460/9438608574_928c22bf2a_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9296583850/" title="IMG_8527 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_8527" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7354/9296583850_a66cd82d9b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9442510880/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5477/9442510880_1f895b8aa4_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9439731129/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5549/9439731129_d578fdf213_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9438685168/" title="IMG_0232 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0232" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5341/9438685168_bd07a3435b_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="640" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5528/9424653071_bb1fd3f82d_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-18" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3692/9438576818_1f2dd33354_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7424/9427422506_6f470613d2_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7291/9435841805_eb09ca8a5d.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435791691/" title="photo-20 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-20" height="375" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5462/9435791691_710b6c2cc7.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435829519/" title="photo-1 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-1" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3667/9435829519_256eb63828.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435780563/" title="photo-25 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-25" height="375" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2846/9435780563_d6782e193a.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9293762575/" title="IMG_9931 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_9931" height="375" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7281/9293762575_0c0ecbd727.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9435908541/" title="IMG_0197 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0197" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3778/9435908541_caba35ea58.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9269679247/" title="photo-3 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-3" height="375" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3746/9269679247_565cca98d9.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9293820009/" title="IMG_0716 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0716" height="500" src="http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5527/9293820009_eb928d668c.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9269669051/" title="photo-12 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo-12" height="375" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2825/9269669051_d9bf0185bc.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9438644008/" title="IMG_0703 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0703" height="500" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3783/9438644008_40b24c13fe.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;object classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000" data="http://www.flickr.com/apps/video/stewart.swf?v=109786" height="500" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="500"&gt; &lt;param name="flashvars" value="intl_lang=en-us&amp;amp;photo_secret=9a10d28b00&amp;amp;photo_id=9424651687"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name="movie" value="http://www.flickr.com/apps/video/stewart.swf?v=109786"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name="bgcolor" value="#000000"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" src="http://www.flickr.com/apps/video/stewart.swf?v=109786" bgcolor="#000000" allowfullscreen="true" flashvars="intl_lang=en-us&amp;amp;photo_secret=9a10d28b00&amp;amp;photo_id=9424651687" height="500" width="500"&gt;&lt;/embed&gt;&lt;/object&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/1322070402948002278/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=1322070402948002278' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1322070402948002278'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/1322070402948002278'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/08/the-month-in-moments-july.html' title='The Month in Moments: July '/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-2100115549294685182</id><published>2013-08-01T00:05:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-08-07T10:20:59.869-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='life story'/><title type='text'>The Power of Post-its</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/7654632262/" title="Red fish, blue fish by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="Red fish, blue fish" height="500" src="http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8141/7654632262_cb94b713eb.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;My kids all walked at different ages, which isn't surprising because they're all different people, but it was surprising to me because Archer was all I knew before Fable...and Archer and Fable were all I knew before Bo and Revi...and before that, all I knew was myself from reading the baby book my mom made for me when I was a babe that is currently falling apart and full of old baby hair and a faded hospital bracelet and cards from my parents' old neighbors.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That's the beauty of being given the task of looking backwards when you don't have the memories for yourself. Here it is, my beginning, of which I know nothing about except that I was there. I was here in this picture and I was there in that house and this hair was once attached to me and now it's... old hair. In an envelope.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Which I appreciate. Because it's the part of my timeline I don't remember.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I don't remember my first birthday and my kids won't remember their first birthdays either, but I will remember those moments for them--the milestones, like post-it notes sticking out of the books I keep and store for them as my mother did for me and hers and hers and hers... until they take over and keep their own journals, online, offline, on the backs of their hands in permanent ink...&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Last week I spent an afternoon on the phone with my Nana discussing how fortunate she is to still have her memory. How lucky all of us are to be able to look backwards because age has a tendency to take that away from us. The eraser gets too close to our blackboards and then, POOF, it's gone.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;"When you are old like me you will find that looking back is what gives you the most joy," she told me. &amp;nbsp;"Revisiting all of those memories, writing them all down. Knowing they're there and you can visit them..."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9354836114/" title="boandrevrpainting by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="boandrevrpainting" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7406/9354836114_6ac4a4efe8_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;I don't understand but I kind of do. I take my mind for granted. I take my ability to think and remember, to sit down with an old journal and summon the ghosts of summers past.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;My Nana's boyfriend was recently diagnosed with Alzeimer's. She writes him letters about the days they spend together so that he can relive them in place of the memory gone missing and it has become an integral part of their relationship. Like the love letters we used to write and pass in class. The ones we thought meant the world. The ones we have saved in our parents' garages and read to remember. Those were as much our milestones as anything.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The first kiss and the first love and the first time you had to hide &lt;a href="http://instagram.com/p/cNJVCirAWa/" target="_blank"&gt;the hickey&lt;/a&gt; from your parents.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Remember me. Remember this. Remember us.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;And if you can't, I will.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;And in case I don't, I'll write it down.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I have been writing it all down since I was eight years old, for better and for worse, and when I pulled out an old journal from 8th grade, I was taken aback by my complete lack of sense but also all of these moments I had forgotten. Moments that had a profound effect on who I am now. Milestones.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/7779175030/" title="IMG_8163 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_8163" height="500" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7258/7779175030_929091fdf8.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;i&gt;Bo's first steps, 11 months&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/8020790815/" title="IMG_1090 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_1090" height="500" src="http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8443/8020790815_6891068729.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;i&gt;Revi started walking just before her first birthday*&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Blogs started out as journals. And for the last eight years, this has been mine--where I come to tell my story and share the moments my mother put down in my baby book. This is where I announce good news and bad news, record first steps and words, go back to remember, cringe slightly, and then move forward with the knowledge that &lt;i&gt;worrying is kind of futile, actually.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I was told, even before Bo and Revi were born that the first year of twin parenting was going to be excruciatingly difficult, but when I look back on that first year, all I see is hope.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The first cries and the first smile and &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2012/08/stand-fall-get-back-up.html" target="_blank"&gt;the first steps&lt;/a&gt; = hope. The first time Bo found her wave...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/g-hNTbYnjdA?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;I was in the kitchen when Bo stood up and walked to me from the hallway. I was in the dining room when Revi stood up and did the same.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;That's what memories do. That's what looking back does.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="https://www.google.com/search?q=don't+look+back+quotes&amp;amp;source=lnms&amp;amp;tbm=isch&amp;amp;sa=X&amp;amp;ei=bVv3UbmQLKmtiQKEnoCYBw&amp;amp;ved=0CAkQ_AUoAQ&amp;amp;biw=1280&amp;amp;bih=642" target="_blank"&gt;Don't look back&lt;/a&gt;, &lt;/i&gt;everyone says.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;But how lucky are we that we can. How fortunate that we have the tools to remind ourselves of the time they... and the time we... &amp;nbsp;and how we all... and it felt like...&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Push forward, look back, push forward, look back.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;This is their dance.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;object classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000" data="http://www.flickr.com/apps/video/stewart.swf?v=109786" height="500" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="500"&gt; &lt;param name="flashvars" value="intl_lang=en-us&amp;amp;photo_secret=2160570d89&amp;amp;photo_id=9407337940"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name="movie" value="http://www.flickr.com/apps/video/stewart.swf?v=109786"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name="bgcolor" value="#000000"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&lt;embed type="application/x-shockwave-flash" src="http://www.flickr.com/apps/video/stewart.swf?v=109786" bgcolor="#000000" allowfullscreen="true" flashvars="intl_lang=en-us&amp;amp;photo_secret=2160570d89&amp;amp;photo_id=9407337940" height="500" width="500"&gt;&lt;/embed&gt;&lt;/object&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;And watching them dance is part of ours.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;blockquote style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" type="cite"&gt;&lt;div dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style="color: black; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;This post is inspired by&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="http://www.shotatlife.org/" style="color: #1155cc;" target="_blank"&gt;Shot@Life&lt;/a&gt;, an initiative of the&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="http://www.unfoundation.org/" style="color: #1155cc;" target="_blank"&gt;United Nations Foundation&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;that educates, connects and empowers the championing of vaccines as one of the most cost effective ways to save the lives of children in the world’s hardest to reach places.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style="color: black; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style="color: black; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;During Shot@Life’s Blogust, 31 bloggers, one each day in August, are writing about moments that matter. &lt;b&gt;For every comment on this post and &lt;a href="http://www.shotatlife.org/blogust/" target="_blank"&gt;the 30 other posts&lt;/a&gt;, Walgreens will donate a vaccine (up to 50,000 vaccines).&lt;/b&gt; A child dies every 20 seconds from a vaccine-preventable disease. We can change this reality and help save kids’ lives!&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style="color: black; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;span style="color: black; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.shotatlife.org/blogust" style="color: #1155cc;" target="_blank"&gt;Sign up here&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;for a daily email so you can quickly and easily comment and share every day during Blogust! Stay connected with Shot@Life at&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="http://www.shotatlife.org/" style="color: #1155cc;" target="_blank"&gt;www.shotatlife.org&lt;/a&gt;, join the campaign on&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="http://www.facebook.com/shotatlifecampaign" style="color: #1155cc;" target="_blank"&gt;Facebook&amp;nbsp;&lt;/a&gt;and follow them on&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="http://www.twitter.com/shotatlife" style="color: #1155cc;" target="_blank"&gt;Twitter&lt;/a&gt;. And be sure to check out &lt;a href="http://mooshinindy.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Casey @ Moosh in Indy's&lt;/a&gt; post tomorrow. Thanks in advance for your comments, friends!&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;***&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div&gt;&lt;div dir="ltr"&gt;&lt;span style="color: black; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="text-align: start;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;*Archer didn't walk until he was &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2006/10/walking-in-la.html" target="_blank"&gt;seventeen months&lt;/a&gt;. &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2010/03/following-my-leader.html" target="_blank"&gt;Fable, too.&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;b style="background-color: white; color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px;"&gt;&lt;/b&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/2100115549294685182/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=2100115549294685182' title='3 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/2100115549294685182'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/2100115549294685182'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/08/the-power-of-post-its.html' title='The Power of Post-its'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>3</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-4509795301031240335</id><published>2013-07-31T16:48:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-07-31T16:48:36.052-07:00</updated><title type='text'>173/100</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I can't stop shaaaaaaaaking, look what we're maaaaaaaaaking.... uh uh. (This one's real good.)&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/AdOWl9a9dc0?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;Shoo-wop and you don't stop.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;***&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;173. Back it Up by: &lt;a href="http://www.caroemerald.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Caro Emerald&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/4509795301031240335/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=4509795301031240335' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/4509795301031240335'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/4509795301031240335'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/07/173100.html' title='173/100'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-7334053185258451988</id><published>2013-07-30T07:59:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-07-30T08:30:53.208-07:00</updated><category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='she section'/><title type='text'>She Section: Making Mom Friends</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;Oh, She Section, it's been a while. Mainly because I couldn't decide what to write about next, here, in this little space, and then I went back and saw that, more than any other topic, friendship was mentioned most, specifically, &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/01/resolute-2013.html" target="_blank"&gt;"making friends with other mothers" and/or "the relationship between mothers and their child-free friends."&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;In fact, the most "liked" comment in the bunch was this: &lt;i&gt;write about how you feel about childless adults - your friends without children, etc.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Which kind of blew my mind. And then I thought back to those early days with Archer and how I had convinced myself that &lt;i&gt;I could only hang out with moms from now on...&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Because for whatever reason, it is assumed that once we become mothers, we must segregate ourselves from the childless.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Because only a fellow mother could understand.&lt;br /&gt;Because new moms join new mom groups.&lt;br /&gt;Because it's just easier this way.&lt;br /&gt;Because that's what I'm supposed to do... right?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;None of my friends had kids when I became a mother, which sucked. Or at least, that's what I told myself. I felt very sorry for myself and my lack of mom friends. So sorry in fact that I closed my old blog (about being myself) and started a new one (about being a mom) because I didn't want anyone who knew me as a mother to know about me &lt;i&gt;before&lt;/i&gt; I was a mother.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Because fellow mothers would surely judge me.&lt;br /&gt;Because new moms only write about being new moms.&lt;br /&gt;Because it was just easier that way.&lt;br /&gt;Because that's what I was supposed to do... right?&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I spent a lot of time those first months writing about "mom friends" as a sort of calling card. I hoped that "if you build it, they will come" style, people would find me on my lonesome woe-is-me island, a lighthouse of potential friendship and soul sisterness, pledging allegiance to our makeshift receiving blanket flag.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;And to our new motherhood, for which it stands.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Girl's Gone Child's 2005 "catchphrase" was literally, &lt;i&gt;welcome to the new titty flashing all nighter.&lt;/i&gt;.. And "who says motherhood means tattoo removal and moving to the suburbs?" which was just me trying to define myself for potential suitors who were, like, "me too, girl. I have tattoos high five."&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Such are the hazards of writing publicly. You have to live with yourself and your archives. You have to live with a book you wrote during a time in your life you were in no place to write a book. You want to talk about trolling? Nobody trolls a blog quite like its author(s). I am the meanest commenter of them all against myself. &amp;nbsp;I bring all this up because it's important to note that at the very least, we have growth to show for our time. Because there was a time I TRULY thought I needed to befriend different versions of myself AKA young (city) moms who had tattoos.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;Which never happened.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;I never befriended any "young tattooed city moms" because (duh) neither of those things really mattered.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;All of this to say that the Internet was kind of a soul-saver for me because it was where I first discovered the power of an ageless, label-less(ish) community: women aged 14-94 all in one space relating to the same subjects, many of whom were in fact "new mothers," MOST of whom were very different than the person I perceived myself to be. This is when/why I realized that being a mother had nothing to do with being a mother. Which brings to me this sample taken from a wonderful post written by my friend,&amp;nbsp;&lt;a href="https://medium.com/the-gathering-kind/f363b5598e88" target="_blank"&gt;Felicia Sullivan&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;-- something I hope you will read, too. Because not only is &lt;a href="http://lovelifeeat.com/" target="_blank"&gt;Felicia&lt;/a&gt; incredibly wise, she's also incredibly warm, helpful, generous and the very definition of "mother," even though she doesn't have kids.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;In &lt;a href="https://medium.com/the-gathering-kind/f363b5598e88" target="_blank"&gt;her words&lt;/a&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div class="" name="2a9d" style="background-color: white; color: #333332; line-height: 31px; margin-bottom: 31px;"&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;a href="https://medium.com/the-gathering-kind/f363b5598e88" target="_blank"&gt;For most of my 16-plus-year career, I’ve made it a point to devote a great deal of my time to mentorship, assembling a motley lot of smart, ambitious women, who ferret me out for advice on everything from internal team conflicts to salary negotiations to feeling confident about their ability and their drive to succeed. Over the years I’ve heard myself labeled as a “den mother,” a lioness protective of her cubs, a strong, sometimes difficult leader, who will always follow a colleague into a conference room and hold them as they cry for twenty minutes straight. Even after I resigned from a social media marketing agency where I served as a managing partner, I still keep in touch with my kids, and I tell them that I can’t wait to witness their inevitable bloom. I tell them that I’m always there if they need me.&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;THAT'S motherhood, man.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;This is, too.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;But so is that.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Having children is not what binds us as friends or as women or as a community.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It took me joining a mom's group (and then very quickly dropping out of a mom's group) to realize that "having children" is not enough of a foundation for a friendship. The world is bloated with beautiful souls and interesting minds and &lt;i&gt;mothers&lt;/i&gt;, some of whom are overlooked in this community because they are not &lt;i&gt;mothers&lt;/i&gt; in the way many of us are. Which is a huge loss for all of us.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;It was for me.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;These days, some of my friends have children and some of them do not, and I have never been happier. Not that playgroups and making friends with fellow moms in one's community can't be awesome. It can be great of course, &lt;i&gt;of course&lt;/i&gt;. But just like motherhood brings out the best in some people it also brings out the crazy in others and I have a zero tolerance policy when it comes to mama judgement in my personal life. And besides, I live with my family every day. I'd much rather talk about other things when I'm amongst friends. LET'S PLEASE TALK ABOUT OTHER THINGS!&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;As for my kids, they went and made their own friends just like I made mine. They made friends at school and camp and in groups they created themselves. Because similarly aged kids don't guarantee a friendship. Because eventually I realized that it wasn't my job to "socialize" my kids. (In the same way it wasn't my kid's job to "socialize" me.)&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9399639694/" title="IMG_0152 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0152" height="640" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3821/9399639694_bbe8c27ceb_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;And, yes, it would totally rule to live next door &lt;a href="http://mightygirl.com/2013/05/02/epic-playdate/" target="_blank"&gt;to friends &lt;/a&gt;whose children have &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2008/12/before-it-gets-complicated.html" target="_blank"&gt;formed bonds&lt;/a&gt; with mine and sometimes the perfect storm occurs and it's like, &lt;a href="http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/05/epicly-ever-after-sponsored.html" target="_blank"&gt;WHOA YOU TWO ARE SOUL BROTHERS&lt;/a&gt;, AWESOME! But in my experience, that has been the exception, not the rule. And that is perfectly fine. &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;Meanwhile, our house is usually full of adults, my friends who are kind enough to come to me knowing that I have a hard time, uh, leaving the house. And these friends have become my kids' friends as well - mentors and confidantes in ways I will never be because, well, I'm their mother, and aunties, are frankly way cooler.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9396870625/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="500" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3796/9396870625_2a7e0902a4.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: start;"&gt;&lt;span style="color: #222222;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9399638878/" title="IMG_0837 by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="IMG_0837" height="500" src="http://farm4.staticflickr.com/3808/9399638878_9d680f6917.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #222222;"&gt;(Uncles, too.)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;****&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;span style="background-color: white; color: #333332; line-height: 31px;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;span style="font-family: inherit;"&gt;&lt;a href="https://medium.com/the-gathering-kind/f363b5598e88" target="_blank"&gt;This puts me to thinking that there are so many ways one can mother. Much like how I’ve woven together the most unconventional of families, where bloodlines are defined as the enormity of beating hearts rather than lineage, I’m designing a life for myself where the women whom I’ve been privileged to mentor are, in some ways, my children.&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;The women I am fortunate enough to call friends are women I have bonded with on a personal/emotional/soulsisterfisttothechestthankyouforgettingme level. They are all &lt;i&gt;mothers&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;in ways that they have defined for themselves. As friends and colleagues, sisters and confidantes.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9399650734/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="640" src="http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7432/9399650734_993987ee1a_z.jpg" width="480" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;They are old and they are young and some will have children someday and some will not. They are married and they are single and all of them are on different life paths because &lt;i&gt;of course they are&lt;/i&gt;. Because happiness and contentment and friendship and family mean different things to every one of us.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Because definition is arbitrary.&lt;br /&gt;Because motherhood is relative.&lt;br /&gt;Because classification is a waste of time.&lt;br /&gt;Because mom groups aren't for everyone. (It's taken me 32 years to recognize that groups are not my thing. And that's totally okay.)&lt;br /&gt;Because what "we're supposed to do" only counts if its right for us.&lt;br /&gt;Because we're allll different.&lt;br /&gt;Because thank god for that.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;***&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;What about you? What has your friend experience been like? &lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;Do you feel pressure to make "mom" friends once you become one? How has motherhood changed your friendships?&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;i&gt;How have your friends who have become mothers changed? What have your experiences been like with mom groups? How do you sustain adult friendships? Looking forward to your comments, all. xo&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/7334053185258451988/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=7334053185258451988' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/7334053185258451988'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/7334053185258451988'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/07/she-section-making-mom-friends.html' title='She Section: Making &lt;del&gt;Mom&lt;/del&gt; Friends'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-4003647723504957185</id><published>2013-07-29T12:51:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-07-29T12:57:13.920-07:00</updated><title type='text'>Okay then.</title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/girlsgonechild/9181604890/" title="photo by girlsgonechild, on Flickr"&gt;&lt;img alt="photo" height="500" src="http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2816/9181604890_3495110aaa.jpg" width="500" /&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Once in a while something happens - something so incredibly simple. So mundane and perfect and completely revolutionary. Something like a child kicking a ball. And all of a sudden it's like, &lt;i&gt;Oh snap. This, right here, is everything. This moment sums up my entire existence as a human. This is what life looks like. This is why we wake up every morning. To kick things. To kick habits. To kick back. To kick up our heels. To say to each other, "I'm alive and kicking." &amp;nbsp;Keep right on kicking...&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;There seems to be a lot of (ahem) "pollen" in the air and we're all sweating balls (balls!) trying to make it all work. And, well, sometimes it doesn't, you know? Sometimes nothing works correctly and life is constipating and we're all super bloated and, you know, gassy, and I don't really know what I'm getting at here except that I want to have more balls. Because moments pass like balls across the lawn and this is what life looks like. This right here, is everything.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;A ball and little feet going for it. Connecting with the &lt;i&gt;sole &lt;/i&gt;purpose of moving it forward. That's what I want. I want to be less concerned with where the ball goes and more concerned with the fact that it's going... somewhere.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;Yes please to all of that. &lt;i&gt;Let's do this, week.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/4003647723504957185/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=4003647723504957185' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/4003647723504957185'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/4003647723504957185'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/07/okay-then.html' title='Okay then.'/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry><entry><id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-18751784.post-9028634656186002764</id><published>2013-07-26T13:29:00.000-07:00</published><updated>2013-07-26T13:29:20.565-07:00</updated><title type='text'>all I need is this scene to watch repeatedly. </title><content type='html'>&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: left;"&gt;I was recently reminded of the following scene and how on certain (loooooooong) days, watching it on repeat is kind of all I need. Besides a chair. And &lt;a href="http://seriouslyforreal.com/funny/the-25-funniest-autocorrects-of-dyacs-first-year/" target="_blank"&gt;this link&lt;/a&gt; that I'm thrilled to say has been passed around a hundred thousand times.&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/4VbI5zcB8Ac?rel=0" width="560"&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="text-align: center;"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Happy weekend, all.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;b&gt;GGC&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</content><link rel='replies' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/feeds/9028634656186002764/comments/default' title='Post Comments'/><link rel='replies' type='text/html' href='http://www.blogger.com/comment.g?blogID=18751784&amp;postID=9028634656186002764' title='0 Comments'/><link rel='edit' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/9028634656186002764'/><link rel='self' type='application/atom+xml' href='http://www.blogger.com/feeds/18751784/posts/default/9028634656186002764'/><link rel='alternate' type='text/html' href='http://www.girlsgonechild.net/2013/07/all-i-need-is-this-scene-to-watch.html' title='all I need is this scene to watch repeatedly. '/><author><name>GIRL'S GONE CHILD</name><uri>http://www.blogger.com/profile/07130764109593048451</uri><email>noreply@blogger.com</email><gd:image rel='http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail' width='32' height='24' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2048/193/1600/ggcsample.0.jpg'/></author><thr:total>0</thr:total></entry></feed>
